loans.name: Lovarisoa

texts.fr:
Lovarisoa est une femme de 38 ans. Elle vit dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches avec son mari et ses 3 filles. Cela fait 15 ans qu’elle travaille dans le domaine de la photographie. En effet, elle a aujourd’hui, près de son domicile,  un petit studio photo et une boutique où elle vend également des objets de décoration ainsi que des cadres. Elle prend directement des photos de ses clients dans son studio mais se déplace également sur demande pour des événements particuliers (fêtes religieuses, mariage…).
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis maintenant 4 ans. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter de nouveaux cadres photos ainsi qu’un nouvel appareil photo.
Les différents prêts qu’elle a obtenus lui ont permis d’acheter du matériel plus élaboré ce qui lui permet de produire un travail de meilleure qualité. Elle espère continuer d’étendre son activité et peut être de diversifier les services et prestations proposées.
texts.en:
Lovarisoa is 38 years old. She lives in the urban commune of Antsirabe in the highlands of Madagascar with her husband and three daughters. She has been working in the field of photography for 15 years. She has a small studio and a stall close to her home where she sells decorative objects as well as photo frames. She directly takes pictures of her clients in her studio, but she also travels on request for particular events (religious festivals, marriages...)

She has been a partner of Vahatra for four years. With this loan, she plans on purchasing new photo frames, as well as a new camera. The different loans she has taken out have allowed her to purchase more elaborate equipment, which in turn has allowed her to produce better quality work. She hopes to continue expanding her business and perhaps diversify the services she offers.

loans.use: to purchase a camera and photographic materials

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 46 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past three years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells human drugs.

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and pay family bills. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more drugs.

loans.name: Tsiro

texts.fr:
Tsiro est une femme volontaire de 30 ans qui vit dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches avec son mari et ses 3 enfants encore en bas âge. C’est à l’âge de 20 ans, alors qu’elle prenait son indépendance et était déjà en train de construire son propre foyer qu’elle s’est lancée dans une activité de vente de poissons. Aujourd’hui, elle fait toujours du commerce de poissons et a installé son magasin dans un quartier populaire de la ville près de son domicile. 
Tsiro est partenaire de Vahatra depuis maintenant 7 ans. Avec ce prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock de poissons et ainsi continuer à augmenter la quantité de produits proposés à la clientèle. 
Les différents prêts obtenus et les bénéfices réalisés lui ont permis d’ augmenter significativement  le volume de son activité et d’améliorer  également l’équipement de son commerce en faisant récemment l’acquisition d’un nouveau congélateur. Elle espère, à moyen terme, pouvoir effectuer les finitions de sa maison et se soucie tout particulièrement du bien-être et de l’avenir de ses trois enfants.
texts.en:
Tsiro is 30 years old. She lives in the urban commune of Antsirabe in the highlands of Madagascar with her husband and three young children. She began living independently when she was 20 years old. She had already begun constructing her own home when she started selling fish for a living. Today, she still sells fish and has established her own store in a working class district close to her home.

Tsiro has been a partner of Vahatra for seven years. With this loan, she plans on replenishing her stock of fish and continuing to increase the quantity of produce she can offer her customers. Her previous loans and the profits she has made from them have allowed her to significantly increase the scope of her business and also to improve her working equipment through the purchase of a new freezer. In the mid-term, she hopes to be able to put the finishing touches to her home. A particular concern of hers is the well-being and futures of her three children.

loans.use: to replenish her stock of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm stock to sell for more income gain.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Nathan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, firewood, and cow feed.

To help expand his business, Nathan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, firewood and cow feed, and will help Nathan to generate greater profits and increase his income. Nathan hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, firewood and cow feed.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Nicholas has been working hard to manage his workshop, which sells welded doors and windows.

To help expand his business, Nicholas has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials, and will help Nicholas to generate greater profits and business expansion. Nicholas hopes that in the future he will be able to get basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential home items.

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential house items, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and expand the business. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more essential house items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Lucy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential household items.

To help expand her business, Lucy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential household items, and will help Lucy to generate greater profits and increase her income. Lucy hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stock.

loans.use: buy more essential household items.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marcos de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y colocando piso cerámico, pero como no tiene de suficiente capital esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y asi poder tener una mejor vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Marcos is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner.  He has been working for a private firm for ten years and he is able to cover some of his household expenses with his earnings.

He wants to fix up his house by plastering the walls and installing ceramic floors. Since he doesn't have enough money for these improvements, he is asking for a loan so he can buy the construction materials he needs to have a better, dignified home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as cement block, cement, steel, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Julienne est une femme courageuse de 41 ans. Elle a élevé 3 garçons avec son mari dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle a dû changer d’activité et s’est lancée, il y a maintenant 2 ans, dans une vente de soldes à son propre compte. Elle propose à sa clientèle divers articles et accessoires de la vie courante (piles, produits cosmétiques, articles ménagers, mercerie…). Elle exerce principalement son activité de manière ambulante et se déplace dans les lieux stratégiques en fonction de l’affluence et des évènements (manifestations particulières telles que les fêtes ou les grands rassemblements).
Julienne a sollicité l’aide de Vahatra au démarrage de son activité il y a 2 ans. Elle a ainsi réussi à augmenter sensiblement son capital et se constituer une petite épargne. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte diversifier les produits qu’elle propose en achetant notamment des lampes torches (500 pièces), des cadenas (20 pièces), des briquets (20 pièces) et ainsi offrir à sa clientèle une plus large gamme d’articles. 
La priorité de Julienne reste de répondre aux besoins de sa famille en assurant, au mieux, le bien être actuel et futur de ses enfants. Pour cela, elle espère, avec les bénéfices de son activité, pouvoir un jour effectuer les finitions de sa maison.
texts.en:
Julienne is 41 years old. She lives in the urban commune of Antsirabe in the highlands of Madagascar with her husband and three sons. In order to meet her family's needs, she had to change her line of work. Two years ago, she started selling her own wares. She offers her customers various day-to-day items and accessories, such as batteries, cosmetic products, domestic items and dry goods. She mainly carries out her business as a wandering street vendor and places herself in strategic positions depending on crowd numbers and special events, such as festivals and large gatherings.

Julienne requested assistance from Vahatra to start up her business two years ago. She has also succeeded in making a distinct increase in her capital and has built up some savings. With this new loan, she plans on diversifying the products she offers by purchasing torch lamps (500), padlocks (20) and cigarette lighters (20), as well as offering her customers a wider selection of goods. Julienne's priorities are still ensuring that her family's needs are meet by assuring her children's current and future well-being as best she can. In order to do this, she hopes to be able to finish construction work on their home with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to purchase lamps, batteries and padlocks

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La socia Agueda se dedica al negocio de venta de maiz,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un locla donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Agueda sells corn from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had this business for five years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a place where she would be able to sell the corn.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Saul Arturo

texts.es: Saúl de 43 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace 25 años, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, Él vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Saúl desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo ya que dentro de poco empieza la época de siembra, para ello solicita un crédito para invertir en: semillas, fertilizante, controles de plagas y abono para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Saúl, age 43, learned to work the land when he was very young.  That is why he has been growing corn and beans for 25 years.  By doing so he manages to get better earnings and to give his family better living conditions.  He lives with his wife and their three children.

Saúl wants to invest in agricultural supplies because the planting season will soon start.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and compost in order to continue his crops.  With this he hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and compost.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 64 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Paulina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Paulina has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro, tiene 63 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad de cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café y es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. La producción que saca la vende en la misma zona. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para darle asistencia técnica a su finca de café, comprará abonos y para pago de limpieza, con esta inversión espera mejorar la producción y obtener ganancias para comprar otro terreno y sembrar mas café.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 63, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife in a village in the Nueva Frontera municipality in Santa Bárbara.

He has always devoted himself to this business activity of growing corn, beans, and coffee.  It is the only source of income for his family.  He sells the production that he gets in the same area.

He has decided to request a loan for 5,000 lempiras in order to provide technical care to his coffee farm.  He will buy fertilizers and pay for clearing the fields.  With this investment he hopes to improve production and to get profits to buy another piece of land and to plant more coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for clearing the fields.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing clothes. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for sewing, and will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and increase income. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to increase stock.

loans.use: buy materials for sewing to increase her profits

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 7 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and increase income. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to increase stock.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder for his general store

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Monday has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar,salt,bread,posho,curry powder. 

To help expand her business, Monday has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,salt,bread,posho,curry powder, and will help Monday to generate greater profits and improve business. Monday hopes that in the future she will be able to improve business.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt,,bread, posho, curry powder, cooking oil

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y hortalizas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Sonia, still works in her farming business.  She has a plot of land where she grows corn and vegetables.  She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has been in this business for several years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her farming business.

Sonia's requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past 5 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his bakery and dairy business, which sells dairy milk, doughnuts,cakes. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dairy, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and add stock. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to increase stock.

loans.use: buy more dairy items and bakery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a stable stall and add more stock of fruits for resale.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is 42 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sharif has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which operates as a supermarket. 

To help expand her business, Sharif has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the supermarket, and will help Sharif to generate greater profits and increase family income. Sharif hopes that in the future she will be able to increase stock.

loans.use: buy more items for her supermarket

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Panimaché Cuarto Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer responsable y disciplinada, que tiene 50 años vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de las edades entre 12 y 19 años en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Maria (es la señora de en medio de la fotografía) para poder adquirir algunas ganancias y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de güipiles típicos de su región, esta labor lo realiza ella des de hace quince años.
Maria ahora se ve a la necesidad de surtir y modernizar las mercaderías de su negocio para poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder realizar la inversión, por tal razón solicita un préstamo junto a un grupo de señoras  para comprar güipiles típicos de diferentes estilos, tamaños y colores.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder comprar un terreno y seguir mejorando su negocio de venta de ropa típica.
texts.en:
Maria is a responsible and disciplined 50 year old woman. She lives together with her four children aged from 12 to 19 years old in a community in Chichicastenango.

Maria (is the woman in the center of the photo) works buying and selling guipiles (traditional blouses) of the region in order to make some income and help her husband support the household expenses. She has been doing this for fifteen years.

Maria now sees the need to stock up and modernize the merchandise in her business to be able to better satisfy the needs of her clients. But one of the difficulties she has is that she doesn't have the capital required to make this investment.

For this reason she is requesting a loan along with a group of women to buy traditional blouses of different styles, colors and sizes. Maria's great dream is to be able to buy a plot of land and continue to improve her business selling clothing.

loans.use: buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia Yenny se dedica al negocio de venta de maíz , por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia quiere salir adelante, a la socia le gustaría tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yenny is a member who works selling maize. She wants to get ahead through this small business. She would like to have premises to be able to sell her maize.

Yenny is asking for a loan to buy maize. She is happy about the loan and undertakes to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 45 años en su almacén misceláneo, inicia su día muy concurrido por los habitantes del sector del barrio donde habita en el municipio de Barranquilla; sus clientes  encuentran a la mano  todo tipo de artículos de papelería, detalles, productos de cuidado de la piel  y el cabello entre otros. Su negoció inicio en el año 2012, motivado por su cónyuge quien le sugirió la apertura de este negocio desde su casa; decidió materializar la idea de negocio obteniendo excelentes resultados por ser una buena plaza, así mismo también genera ingresos para su hogar al  ofrecer servicios de mantenimiento de piscinas a conocidos y referidos.  Su hijo y cónyuge son su principal motivación para trabajar comprometido, él trabaja todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de papelería, cremas corporales, colonias y cosméticos, ajustando su oferta a la demanda de sus clientes y manejar un variado surtido.  Su meta a futuro es remodelar su vivienda y ampliar el surtido en su miscelánea.
texts.en:
Manuel is 45 and has a general store. Every morning the locals of the area of the neighbourhood where he lives in Barranquilla make the shop very busy. His customers have at hand all kinds of stationery items, gifts and skin and hair care products among others. 

He started his business in the year 2012 encouraged by his spouse who suggested the opening of this business from his house. He decided to make this business idea a reality and obtained great results because the shop is well located. He also generates income for his household by offering swimming pool maintenance services to acquaintances. His son and spouse are his main motivation to be committed with work.

He works everyday from 8 am to 6 pm and is currently applying for a Kiva loan –first funding he gets from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will buy stationery items, body lotions, perfumes and cosmetics adjusting his offer to the demand of his customers while having a wide range of products. His goal for the future is to remodel his house and increase the range of products of his general store.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, body lotions, perfumes and cosmetics adjusting his offer to the demand of his customers while having a wide range of products.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Умеда 20 летняя молодая, красивая девушка. Честно говоря, она уже  самостоятельная, активная, и талантливая девушка.  Умеда всегда старается и думает о новых вещах. Кстати, Умеда занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды. В швейном деле ей нравится придумать новый стиль одежды, и общаться с новыми клиентами. 
Умеда живет вместе матерью и братом в городе Душанбе. У Умеды скоро свадьба. И ей не хватала денежных средств для купли свадебных принадлежности. Она хочет приобрести мебель, и по этой причине Умеда обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Она нуждается в кредит. Вы можете поддержать Умеды!
texts.en:
Umeda is a young, beautiful woman of 20. She is already an independent, active and talented young woman who is always trying and thinking about new things. She works sewing traditional women's clothing and likes to dream up new styles and to work with new customers.

Umeda lives together with her mother and brother in the city of Dushanbe. She is getting married soon and doesn't have enough money to buy what she needs for her marriage. She wants to buy furniture and for this reason is approaching you for a loan. She needs this loan and you can support her.

loans.use: to buy items related to her wedding

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more supplies and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and improve business. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to improve business.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, etc

loans.name: Raihan

texts.ru: Райхан, 50 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Райхан в обороте на сегодня 4 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает рис для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Райхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров.  Доходы от кредита Райхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Raihan is 50 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four cows and 10 sheep as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows rice for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Raihan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by purchasing cattle. She plans to put profits from her loan into further building her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm input for use in the farm for high farm produce to sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Peregia

texts.en:
Peregia is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Peregia has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beers and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Peregia has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beers and soft drinks and will help Peregia to generate greater profits and improve business. Peregia hopes that in the future she will be able to improve business.

loans.use: buy more beers and soft drinks

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar,salt,bread,posho,curry powder. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,salt,bread,posho,curry powder, and will help David to generate greater profits and improve business. David hopes that in the future he will be able to improve business.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho and other store items

loans.name: Thet's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Thet is 31 years old, a mother of three children. Because of her living condition, she can earn income via cassava growing and fishing for thirteen years. She could earn around 38,900KHR per day. 

As the leader a group of two, Thet took the third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees on her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Shaheya

texts.en:
Shaheya is married and has 3 sons and one daughter. Her husband is a farmer. She started a fruits and vegetables sales project to help him with the family income because the income from farming is very small and cannot cover the monthly expenses of their family. 

Shaheya is requesting a 3000 EGP loan to buy more fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, apples and bananas to increase her sales especially in Ramadan and the feast season

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, apples and bananas.

loans.name: Somat's Group

texts.en:
Somat, 30, lives with family members in a rural village of Kratie province. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is in school and others are too young to attend school. She earns income to support her family’s living via fishing, doing rice farming and working on other farm for fee for twelve years. She could earn around 38,300KHR per day.

This is the fifth loan cycles for Somat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of this group of two, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy fishing materials. She hopes to upgrade her family’s living to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to improve her income

loans.name: Heritiana

texts.fr:
Heritiana est une femme de 41 ans, originaire de la campagne. Elle vit aujourd’hui, entourée de son mari, de son fils et de ses 2 filles dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches. Elle y exerce depuis maintenant 10 ans une activité de vente de produits locaux (légumes, céréales, fruits, sucre…). Elle vend ses produits dans un quartier populaire de la ville près de son domicile.
Heritiana est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 7 ans. Grâce aux différents prêts qu’elle a obtenus, elle a réussi à augmenter significativement son capital ainsi que le volume de son activité. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock de marchandises et acheter notamment 500 kg de riz, 200 kg de maïs, 200 kg de manioc…
L’activité d’Heritiana lui permet de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Elle est également parvenue à se constituer une petite épargne qu’elle espère consolider pour pouvoir, un jour, acquérir un terrain.
texts.en:
Heritiana is a 41-year old woman born in the countryside. Today she lives with her husband, son and two daughters in the urban community of Antsirabe on the high plateaus of Madagascar. For 10 years she has been selling local products (vegetables, cereals, fruits, sugar, etc). She sells these products in a working-class neighborhood in town, not far from her home.

Heritiana has been working with Vahatra for seven years. Thanks to multiple loans obtained in the past, she has been able to bolster her capital and her sales volume significantly. With this new loan, she plans to restock her wares by purchasing, for example, 500 kg [1100 lbs] of rice, 200 kg [440 lbs] of corn, and 200 kg of manioc [cassava]. Heritiana's business allows her to provide for her family's everyday needs. She also has managed to put some money aside as savings, which she hopes to grow over time in order to buy a land plot one day.

loans.use: to stock up on rice, corn, and cassava.

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en:
Edreda is 39 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Edreda has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which rears chicken. 

To help expand her business, Edreda has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more layers and broilers, and will help Edreda to generate greater profits and increase standards of living. Edreda hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more layers and broilers for her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloth material.

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Susita works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Susita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

Susita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, one of whom in school.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets to raise and sacks of feeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice.

Zita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and sacks of feeds

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
En, 47, is a mother of two children who are in school, living in Mondulkiri province. She grows cassava and works on other farms for fee. Her income is about 103,200KHR per day to support her family’s living. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid back the loan. The previous loan helps her to have a better living condition. 

Now, she is applying for this new Kiva loan in order to pay for plowing fees on her cassava plantation. She hopes to earn more income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees on her cassava plantation

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help Edward to generate greater profits and growth of business. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more timber for his wood selling business

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en:
John Baptist is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, John Baptist has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, firewood, and cow feeds. 

To help expand his business, John Baptist has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, firewood,and cow feeds, and will help John Baptist to generate greater profits and pay his family's expenses. John Baptist hopes that in the future he will be able to build rentals.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder, firewood, and cow feeds

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 26 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has no children.

For the past 3 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho (maize flour), and curry powder. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and business expansion. 

Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, bread,and posho

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 27 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Monica has been working hard to manage her retail business, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Monica hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, curry powder

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school.

For the past 15 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells grocery items like groundnuts. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more grocery items, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and business expansion.

Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school.

For the past 15 years, Janet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho (maize flour), and curry powder. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder, and will help Janet to generate greater profits and earn income.

Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 24 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with none currently in school.

For the past 4 years, Happy has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Happy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy items for the salon, and will help Happy to generate greater profits and expand the business.

Happy hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the salon.

loans.use: to buy items for the salon

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has no children.

For the past 5 years, Emanuel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, bread, posho (maize flour), and curry powder. 

To help expand his business, Emanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder, and will help Emanuel to generate greater profits and increase capital.

Emanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire more funds.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, bread, posho, and curry powder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, milk and cooking oil for sale in order to provide basic needs for her family members

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Roselyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Mayra, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo, ella vive con sus padres e hijo en la comunidad de el Negrito, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, inicio vendiendo sandalias y zapatos. Hace 3 años comenzó con la elaboración y venta de comidas como carne asada, tamales, tacos, baleadas y otras que le piden. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos. Ella está solicitando un préstamo en forma grupal  para comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas como ser carnes, harina, verduras, condimentos, refrescos y otros, con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y ganancias. El grupo al que pertenece se llama Esfuerzo, integrado por 7 miembros que realizan diferentes actividades de generación de ingresos y viven en la misma zona. El préstamo total del grupo es por 77,000 Lempiras para surtir sus negocios y seguir trabajando. En la foto están de pie Misael a la izquierda, Marisela y José a la derecha; sentados está Mayra  a la izquierda, Martha, paula y María a la derecha.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 29-year-old single mother with one dependent child. She lives with her parents and her son in the community of Negrito, Yoro. She has always worked in commerce, and started off selling sandals and shoes. Three years ago, she started making and selling meals such as roast meat, tamales, tacos and "baleadas" (a typical Honduran dish like a tortilla), as well as other things that people request. She runs this business from home, and it is her source of income.

Mayra is asking for a group loan, and she wants to buy the necessary ingredients to make meals, including meat, flour, vegetables, condiments and cold drinks. This will achieve her goal of improving her sales and her profits.

She belongs to the Esfuerzo group, which consists of 7 members who all carry out different jobs to earn money and who all live in the same area. The group loan is for 77,000 Honduran Lempiras, which will stock their businesses and allow them to continue working.

In the photo, standing up we can see Misael on the left and Marisela and José on the right. Mayra is seated on the left, with Martha, Paula and María on the right.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, vegetables, condiments, cold drinks and other items to make and sell meals.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Bintou est la cliente qui tient la calebasse d’arachide en main.
Agée de cinquante-sept ans (57 ans), Bintou est une commerçante malienne des céréales. Mariée, mère de trois (03) enfants tous fréquentés le Medersa. Bintou rêve dans les jours à venir de payer des bœufs et moutons pour ses enfants. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle se défend beaucoup dans son activité. Djènèba a fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir et développer son activité. Elle a fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir son activité. Elle fait ses achats d'arachide et de paniers dans la foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Bintou stocke son arachide et le décortique et revend ses grains à la  même foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Elle revend ses paniers à l’étranger.  Bintou fait des bénéfices variant entre vingt mille (20 000 FCFA)   à soixante mille francs (60 000 FCFA) . Bintou fait le commerce des arachides et paniers depuis plus de douze (12 ans). Grace aux prêts du RMCR, elle mène bien son activité. Elle ne se plaint pas pour le déroulement de son activité.
texts.en:
Bintou is the client holding the calabash full of groundnuts. She is fifty-seven. Bintou is a cereal retailer from Mali. She is married and a mother of three; all her children attend the madrasa. In the future, Bintou dreams of buying oxen and sheep for her children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

She works hard in her business. She turned to RMCR to support her business. She purchases groundnuts and baskets from her local weekly fair. Bintou stocks her groundnuts, peels them, and resells the grain at the same local weekly fair. She resells her baskets abroad.

Bintou makes profits ranging from twenty thousand (20,000) to sixty thousand (60,000) XOF. Bintou has been trading in groundnuts and baskets for over twelve (12) years. Thanks to the loans from the RMCR, she conducts her business successfully. She has no complaints regarding her business development.

loans.use: to buy groundnut bags and baskets, and later resell them.

loans.name: El Pilon Group

texts.es: Juan, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Juan siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café, el café es lo que le genera mayor ingreso para el sostenimiento familiar. El solicita un segundo préstamo a la institución y es en forma grupal, piensa comprar abonos para darle asistencia a su finca de café para mejorar tanto la producción como sus ingresos. Su plan es crecer como productor de café y hacer un patrimonio para su familia. El grupo que han formado se llama El Pilón, que lo integran 5 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y se conocen en la misma comunidad. Solicitan un préstamo total por 32,000 lempiras para darle asistencia a sus cultivos. En la Foto esta Santos a la izquierda, Juan, Edwin, Danilo a la derecha y al frente esta María.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He lives in a community that is part of the Gracias, Lempira municipality.  

Juan has always worked in agriculture, raising corn, beans, and coffee.  Coffee is what brings in the most money to support his family.  

He is asking the institution for a second loan—a group loan.  He is thinking of buying fertilizer to help his coffee crop, in order to improve his production as well as his income.  His plan is to grow as a coffee producer and to create an inheritance for his family.  

The group that has been created is called “El Pilón.”  It has five members who work in agriculture and who are known in the community.  They are asking for a loans that total 32,000 lempiras in order to aid their crops.  In the photo, Santos is on the left, Juan, Edwin, and Danilo are on the right, and María is in front.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers in order to help his coffee crop

loans.name: Keady's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children living in Kratie province, Keady is 45 years old. To struggle her family’s hardship, she earns income via cassava growing and working on others for a fee to earn more income. 

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. And now, she is applying to take the new Kiva loan to buy farming supplies for her cassava farming. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her cassava farming

loans.name: Sherifa

texts.en:
Sherifa is a 38-year-old housewife and a former pig farmer. She has three children and a niece who lives with her family in Lilongwe. Two years ago she owned 14 pigs which were all lost due to diseases. She believes the disease was brought into her flock by a customer who usually came to buy stock for slaughter. Losing her flock forced her out of the market and in the process she lost reliable customers. 

Sherifa wants to go back doing what she enjoys doing best; raising pigs, because she was able to generate income through returns and help add household income. She believes the loan will help her resume her pig-raising business. She is going to access pigs in the form of capital, put her pigsty to use and build her capacity in terms of improved management, such as bio-security to prevent occurrence of diseases. Through returns, Sherifa is looking forward to repaying her loan successfully so that she can provide insurance cover for her stock to reduce risks and uncertainties. Her goal is to expand her enterprise, which in return will create employment for others and become a major supplier of pork in Lilongwe town.

loans.use: purchase pigs and receive training in improved management of pig production

loans.name: Adzitowoe

texts.fr: Revendeuse de mèches, pagnes et de l'eau depuis 2003 à domicile, Adzitowoe demande un troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère après la vente subvenir aux besoins de la famille et rendre pérenne son activité. Elle est âgée de 44ans.
texts.en:
Adzitowoe has retailed hair extensions, local fabrics, and water from her home since 2003. She is requesting a third loan to purchase merchandise to meet her clients’ needs.

After the sale, she hopes to provide for her family and to make her business sustainable. She is 44 years old.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, fabrics...

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Happy has been working hard to manage his food stall, which sells fruits. 

To help expand his business, Happy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits, and will help Happy to generate greater profits and increase stock. Happy hopes that in the future he will be able to get capital.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling at his market stall

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjoavi est mère de famille.Âgée de 35ans, elle est mariée à un agent du port. Adjoavi est revendeuse de bois de chauffage et de charbons de bois. Adjoavi est revendeuse depuis 2009. Avec ce crédit sollicité,elle va s'approvisionner pour augmenter son stock. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is a thirty-five year-old mother. She is married to a port agent.

Adjoavi retails firewood and charcoal. She has been a retailer since 2009. With the requested loan, she will procure supplies to increase her stock.

Her plans for the future are to grow her business and to guarantee a future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Maria Corazon is married and has a purified water business in the Philippines. She also has a sari-sari, or small general store to earn her additional income.

Maria Corazon has borrowed and successfully repaid seventeen prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She is now applying for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy more purified water to sell to her customers. She is always working hard to develop her business and so support her family.

loans.use: to buy more purified water to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 59 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Doris has an internet café business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years. Doris requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

In the future, Doris would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace dos años que inició su propio negocio de compra y venta de leche de vaca, este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia y lo realiza en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 22,000 Lempiras para comprar mas leche y revender con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene y aumentar sus ingresos. Tiene como meta seguir incrementando el negocio y aumentar las ganancias para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Two years ago, she started her own business purchasing and selling cow's milk This business is her only source of income to support her family and she runs it from her home. 

She has decided to request a loan of 22,000 lempiras to purchase more milk and resell it in order to cover the demand that she has and improve her income. The goal she has is to continue increasing her business and her profit to support her family.

loans.use: purchase cow's milk to resell.

loans.name: Kyein Chaung Village

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Hla, is 58 years old, married, and supports a family of 10 (8 children). Hla has five acres of crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. He is very proud that all of the children are helping him on the farm. 

The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and to hire laborers needed on the farm. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. Farming is a family tradition and runs in his blood. Even though there are many difficulties such as weather situations, he is hoping to make a better life for his family and the rest of the farmers in the country. He is looking forward to purchasing more acre of fields in the near future, also with income generated from this loan.

Pictured above (from left to right) are Hla, Zaw, Saw, Thaung and Khein.

The CBO leaders oversee the group of 13. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Kyein Chaung Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as betel trees, coconut trees and banana trees, for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi vit à Lomé et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de pain. Elle se fait aider par 02 personnes dans son activité et demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter de la farine de blé, du sucre. Elle souhaite agrandir l'activité et subvenir à ses besoins. Elle est âgée de 27ans.
texts.en:
Ablavi lives in Lomé. She generates revenues from a bread retail business. She gets help from two people in her business.

She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to purchase wheat flour and sugar. She wants to develop her business and provide for herself.

She is twenty-seven years old.

loans.use: `to buy flour, wheat, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mangoes and oranges to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flower seedlings to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail goods for sale to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a stall and add more stock to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 53 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Annie has a food market business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years. Annie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell on her stall.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

Gloria has been in this business for four years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 61 years old and married with nine children.

Herminia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Herminia has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Herminia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Michelle works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Michelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle-transport business.

Michelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Bunlong

texts.en: Bun Long is 61 years old and lives in Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of six children and only one of them is in school. Growing rice, corn and sesame have been the source of her family’s income for past forty three years. To earn additional income for her family, her son wants to create a new business, repairing motorbikes. Due to a lack of funds to fulfill her needs, she is now applying for this Kiva loan via Visionfund to spend on her son learning motorbike repairing technical fee. She hopes that this loan will help her family to earn more income to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for her son's technical fees in learning motorbike repair

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Ya Ma Nay Chaung Village

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Myint, has six acres of crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. He is 53 years old, married, and supports a family of four (two children). He is a proud father because all of his children are independent and working by themselves. Farming runs in his blood but like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. 

The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and petrol for farm equipment. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. Myint is planning to use income generated from this loan to invest in duck farming as a secondary business. Some of the profits will be donated to the local monastery after the harvests.

The fund will help 15 members and is supervised by CBO leaders of the Ya Ma Nay Chaung Village. Pictured above (from left to right) are Win, Aung, Naing, Naing L and Myint.

The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ya Ma Nay Village mainly focuses on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation of betel, coconut and banana trees for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase farming essentials such as fertilizers and fuels for farming machines.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees. She has opened a beauty salon to get extra income. 

She sells charcoal at the market on both a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm inputs for use on the farm to increase the amount of her farm produce and sell it to earn more income

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Ma. Ruby dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize flour, cassava flour, beans, rice and ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en: Saroeun lives in Battambang province. She is 57 years old and a mother of four children. Her family's hardship is a struggle. She has earned income farming cassava for five years. Her daily income is about 75,200 KHR per day. Saroeun is now leading a group of two to take this loan with VisionFund in order to buy seeds and pay for the labor fee to support her cassava farming. In the future, she expects to expand her business to get more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the labor fee to support her cassava farming

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 59 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in Uganda. He is married and has 7 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his tourism business. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build a bigger office and will help Richard to generate greater profits and increase capital. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: build a bigger office

loans.name: Leoncio Prado Group

texts.es: Elena pertenece al grupo "Leoncio Prado" un grupo formado por 5 personas  emprendedoras con ganas de salir adelante,Elena es Secretaria dentro del grupo,donde la relacion de los integrantes es buena y unida.Elena tiene 42 años,madre de una hija de 14 años de edad que todavía se encuentra en la escuela,Elena trabaja en su negocio de peluquería 8 horas diarias desde hace 2 años,sus principales clientes son amigos de su zona y clientes que ha ido ganando poco a poco por su buen trabajo y carisma,ya que su máximo sueño es poner un salón de belleza grande y siente que no esta lejos de poder lograrlo,Elena se siente contenta por haber obtenido este préstamo por que así podrá comprar secadoras,maquinas de peluqueria y más,Elena Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo que da al grupo, ya que le ayuda a salir adelante y a darle mejor calidad de vida a su hija. "Gracias Kiva,su ayuda será aprovechada al máximo,no los defraudaremos."
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the group “Leoncio Prado”, a group comprised of 5 entrepreneurial people with the desire to get ahead. Elena is the secretary of the group which has a nice and united relationship among the members. Elena is 42 years old and mother to a 14 year old daughter who is still in school. 

Elena has worked at her barbershop for 8 hours per day for 2 years. Her main customers are friends from the area and customers who she has gained, little by little, because of her good work and charisma. Her greatest dream is to start a big beauty salon and she feels like she is not far from achieving it. Elena feels happy for having obtained this loan because that way she will be able to buy hair dryers, hair cutting machines and more. 

Elena thanks the Kiva investors for the support they give the group since it helps her to get ahead and to provide a better quality of life for her daughter.”Thank you Kiva. Your help will be fully taken advantage of. We will not let you down.”

loans.use: to buy hair dryers, grooming machines, shampoo and others.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en San Sebastián, Lempira. Se ha dedicado siempre a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijoles, hortalizas y últimamente al café, el cual vende en pergamino húmedo y seco en el mercado local. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y pago de trabajadores para fertilizar su finca de café y poder sacar mejor cosecha este año. Su plan es tener una finca tecnificada y seguir sembrando café.
texts.en:
Jesús is 40, married, and has 4 children. He lives in San Sebastián, Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture, growing maize, beans, vegetables and, most recently, coffee. He sells this as wet and dry coffee parchment at his local market. This work is his source of income.

He is asking for a loan of 25,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy manure and to pay for labourers to fertilise his coffee farm and bring about the best harvest for this year. His plan is to introduce modern technology to his farm and to carry on sowing coffee.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay for labourers to fertilise his coffee farm.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and married with ten children. Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 48 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Dominic has been working hard to manage his tailoring business, which deals in sewing clothes. 

To help expand his business, Dominic has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sewing machines, and will help Dominic to generate greater profits and increase capital. Dominic hopes that in the future he will be able to business expansion.

loans.use: buy more sewing machines for his clothing business

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rachael has been working hard to manage her retail business, which makes envelopes. 

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy paper for making more envelopes and will help Rachael to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Rachael hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land.

loans.use: buy paper for making more envelopes

loans.name: Vasquez Yupanqui

texts.es: Andrés un joven de 19 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de mecánica de mantenimiento en el instituto “Senati”, el cual le va muy bien ya que le agrada dicha carrera Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo y la confianza brindada. Su mayor deseo es de culminar con éxito sus estudios El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de sus estudios. Andrés agradece a los inversionistas kiva que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 19-year-old young man who is currently studying in a mechanical maintenance degree program in the Senati Institute. It is going very well for him, as he likes this field. He is grateful to his parents for the support and trust they have given him. His greatest wish is to finish his education successfully.

The loan that he is requesting will go toward paying for his education. Andrés thanks the Kiva lenders who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Ma. Jona

texts.en:
Forty-five year old Ma. Jona runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic house hold commodities like coffee, sugar, edible oil, noodles, canned goods and soap. She is 45 year old with four dependents. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 9. Her husband earns a living by being a driver.

Ma. Jona is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks and school supplies. This will attract more customers to her shop and make purchases. In this way, her income will slowly improve and she will be able to pay her obligations.
Thus, she could be able to expand her store and provide her family with nutritious diets. And also continue send her children to school for a brighter future.

 She is determined to manage her current source of income properly for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for her sari-sari store and school supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising carabao. Edna is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of blouses, pants, school uniform and other ready-to-wear clothing  for her clothing sales business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of blouses, pants, school uniform and other ready-to-wear clothing .

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy comes from Nyakatokye.  She is a widow with 4 children but only one still goes to school.  She has a retail shop where she earns a living. She took a loan of UGX1,500,000 to re- stock her business. Her challenge is that she pays high rent and yet her business can’t yield much. Her hope is to see herself construct a permanent shelter for her family.  She appreciates the financial boost accorded his business.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: José Jeison

texts.es: José Jeison, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Jeison is 23 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their son; they are his top priority. With his loan, he plans to make a purchase of good-quality bean seeds that will have good germination, organic fertilizers that will help him to improve the conditions of the soil, and other products to apply to his crop. In addition, he will pay for manual labor for field preparation tasks, work to help him prevent erosion damage from rains, and also to apply the products and assist in the fields once they are growing; all this will assure that he does a good job. 

José Jeison intends to take advantage of the area's good climate and soil conditions for this crop, and also to put into practice his several years' experience in managing staple crops. In addition, he intends to be able to buy the best and highest-quality products so that his crop will have good growth and health as well as an adequate harvest, and to have significant production in the near future. He would like to use the income from the harvest that he expects to obtain for his family's well-being and education, to achieve some family goals, and to invest more in his crops. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow beans

loans.name: Solema

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Solema lives in a small kaccha (made of mud and straw) house in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar. She is married with three children (two sons and a daughter). Her only daughter is married, and her sons are in college. This illiterate woman, who can sign her name only, helps her husband Ayub in his agribusiness.

Solema's husband cultivates various types of crops and vegetables. Along with Solema, he works tirelessly to give financial sustenance to her family. It is crucial for them to ensure that the production is abundant. Their income is being generated from the sale of crops and vegetables, but now they want to concentrate on maize cultivation because this is a very profitable crop. The main challenge is lack of capital to carry out farming activities. So, Solema applied for a loan from BJS, Kiva’s partner, for financial assistance.

She will use this loan to purchase agricultural materials such as seeds, manure, pesticides, etc. for maize cultivation. Solema hopes this loan will give a boost to her business and income, which will improve her family's living standards. With the profit, she intends to build a concrete house in the future.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Aldea Panimatzalam Group

texts.es:
Mira es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad, es casada vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad denominada Aldea Panimache.
Maria (es la primea del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa color azul pavo) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de refacciones en la escuela de su comunidad, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace cinco años. Pero también se dedica a la cultivo de una diversidad de verduras.
Maria  con la época de lluvia quiere aprovechar de la mejor manera posible todos sus terrenos para poder sembrar, pero una de la dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes, pero como ella es una gran líder en su comunidad y para realizar su objetivo organizo a un grupo de señoras con la mismas necesidades para solicita un préstamo y satisfacer  esta necesidad.
Maria espera poder contar con el préstamo para poder cultivar en este año para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y comprar más terrenos.
texts.en:
María is a 42-year-old mother. She is married and lives with her four children in the community of Aldea Panimache.

María is the first on the right in the photo, wearing a peacock-blue blouse. She wants to earn an income and help her family get ahead. In order to do this, she has been working for five years selling refreshments at a local school. She also grows various kinds of vegetables.

María wants to make the most of the rainy season in the best way she can by sowing on all her land. However, one of her problems is that she has not got sufficient money to buy seeds and fertilisers. However, being a great leader in her community, and in order to achieve her goal, she organised a group of women in the same situation as herself to ask for a loan that would meet their needs.

Maria hopes to use the loan to grow produce this year, so she can continue to improve her family's quality of life and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: Lida Luz

texts.es: Lida es una emprendedora mujer de 32 años, habitante de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de soledad,  que ante la situación de desempleo en la que se encontraba, consideró que ejerciendo una actividad comercial podría generar recursos para su sustento. Aunque su principal desafío ha sido el insuficiente capital para invertir, ella ha logrado responder a los encargos de mercancías que le han solicitado sus clientes.  Su oferta de productos es muy variada, entre ellos se encuentran los productos de tocador, ropa y calzado,  ventas que promueve a sus amigos y conocidos en El Copey municipio del Departamento del Cesar.  Sus proveedores son los almacenes y distribuidoras a quienes les realiza las compras de contado, sin embargo le han ofrecido la confianza de realizar compra a crédito.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual será invertido en la compra de ropa, calzado y variedades.
