Con esta inversión pretende incrementar su capital de trabajo y obtener más utilidades. Su meta a futuro es mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lida, 32, is an enterprising woman who lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad and who thought that engaging in a commercial enterprise would be able to generate resources for her sustenance when she found her self unemployed.  Although her principal challenge has been insufficient capital to invest, she has been able to answer the demands for merchandise that her customers have requested.  Her offering of products is varied, among which are beauty products, clothing and footwear which she sells to her friends and acquaintances in El Copey, a municipality in the department of Cesar.  Her providers are warehouses and distributors from which she makes cash purchases, however, they have offered her the trust to make purchases on credit.
Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which will be invested in the purchase of clothing, footwear, and a variety of other things.  With this investment, she will increase her working capital and obtain more profitableness.  Her future goal is to improve her quality of life and continue growing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and a variety of other things.

loans.name: Wilian Leonardo

texts.es: Wilian, tiene 24 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Wilian se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy joven junto a su familia y hace 3 años tiene su propio cultivo de café principalmente, aunque siembra maíz y frijoles también. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para dar mantenimiento a su finca de café. Su sueño es llegar a ser gran caficultor, producir en cantidad y calidad de café y poderle dar mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilian, 24, is married, has two children, and lives in a hamlet in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  Wilian has been making a living in agriculture since he was very young along with his family and for three years he has had his own crop of coffee principally, although he also plants corn and beans.  
He has requested a loan of 10,000 Lempiras in order to buy manure and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to maintain his coffee farm.  His dream is to become a great coffee farmer, to produce coffee in quantity and quality, and be able the give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras De Chitulul Group

texts.es:
Herminia es una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora que para darle lo mejor a sus seis hijos se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Herminia (se ubica en la segunda fila, la primera de derecha a izquierda) junto a un grupo de señora está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar abono químico para el cultivo de maíz y ejote, pues ella ya tiene la tierra labrada pero no cuenta con el abono para poder cultivarlos.
Herminia junto a su grupo tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el préstamo para poder cultivar en esta temporada y obtener mejores ingresos.
El gran sueño de Herminia es poder apoyar a sus hijos para construirles su casa propia y dejarles terreno para puedan vivir de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Herminia is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who earns her living making traditional clothing of her region in order to give her six children the best. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

Herminia (located in the second row, the first from right to left), together with a group of women, is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy chemical fertilizer for corn and green bean crops, as she already has the soil plowed but doesn't have the fertilizer to be able to cultivate it.

Herminia, along with her group, has hopes of obtaining the loan in order to be able to farm this season and to earn better income. Her greatest dream is to be able to support her children by building them a home of their own and leaving them land so that they will be able to live in the same way.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for corn and green bean crops

loans.name: Sit Kone Village Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Tin, is 63 years old, married, and supports a family of eight (six children). He is a proud father because all the children are independent. Farming runs in Tin's blood, as the family has been doing farming through generations. He farms on his five acres of crop farm.

This funding will have many benefits in Tin’s business, such as regulations in cash flow, as it needs huge capital before the harvest season. It will also help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizer and petrol for farm equipment. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield.

From the profits generated from the loan, he is planning to buy a pig. Furthermore, he is also a very active community leader in the village.

Sit Kone Village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and has over 80 households. Pictured above (from left to right) are Tin, Myint, San, Htay, and Khin. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 26. The funding will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Sit Kone Village mainly focuses on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantations such as betel, bananas, and coconut trees.

loans.use: to rent farming machines, and purchase fertilizers and petrol for farm equipment.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 54 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilou has a food market business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell in her stall.

Marilou has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Ywar Thar Aye Village

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Kyaw, is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of seven (five children). Four of them are students and studying in nursery school, fourth grade, seventh grade, and ninth grade. The eldest son is helping in the fields to boost the family's income. Farming runs in Kyaw's blood, as it has been done through generations.

Like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizer and petrol for farm equipment. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. His main priority plan is saving as much as he can for his four children to finish their educations. He also volunteers in the local community to support the members.

Pictured above (from left to right) are Than, Tin, Si, and Kyaw. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 20. The funding will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ywar Thar Aye Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantations such as coconut trees, flowers, and banana trees.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for sale, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and increase working capital. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more shoes for sale and expand her working capital for better sales and service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of fruits and tomatoes for sale so as to meet family needs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells Irish potatoes and yams. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more Irish potatoes and yams and will help Grace to generate greater profits and meet other business demands. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to open a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more fresh produce, like potatoes and yams for sale

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Celia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Celia has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from firewood retail.

Celia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is 36 years old and from Minia. He is married and has two sons and two daughters. He has an upholstery cloth project, and it is the only source of income for the family.

He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy modern styles of cloth for his project, to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy modern styles of cloth.

loans.name: Lsa

texts.en:
Lsa is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Lsa has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells household items. 

To help expand his business, Lsa has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more house hold items like sugar, rice, cooking oil and other items, and will help Lsa to generate greater profits and meet shop dues.  Lsa hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big retail shop.

loans.use: buy more household items like sugar, rice, cooking oil and other items, to expand his inventory and sales

loans.name: Ana Vita

texts.es: Ana Vita, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol que se adapte bién a las condiciones de clima y suelo de la zona y de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y compra de fertilizantes  y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ana Vita is 29 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children, who are her top priority. With her loan she intends to buy bean seeds that are well adapted to the climate and soil conditions of the area, and are of good quality in order to germinate well, and fertilizers and other products to apply to the crop. 

She also will pay for labor to prepare the fields and to work to help keep the rain water from causing damage through erosion, as well as apply the products and help to plant once it is developed. This way she can ensure that good work is done. 

She intends to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions for this crop, as well as to put into practice several years of experience in managing basic grains. In addition she intends to be able to buy the best products so that her crop develops well and produces a good harvest, with significant yield in the short term.

She hopes to use the income from the harvest for study and the well being of her family, to reach some family goals, and to continue investing in her crops. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not previously had loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow beans.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: Leydi, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol que se adapte bién a las condiciones de la zona y de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leydi, 34, is married and lives with her husband and her children who are her biggest priority.  
With her loan, she intends to buy seed beans which are well-adapted to the conditions of the zone, of good quality, and that have a good germination as well as fertilizers which will help her improve the condition of the soil and other products to apply to the crops.  In addition, she will pay for the labor to prepare the land and the work which will help so that the rains don't cause erosion damage, and also for the application of products and assistance with the crop once it begins to grow and in this way assure that it will be a good job.  
She wants to take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions which this zone offers the crop and also put into practice several years of experience in the handling of basic grains.  In addition to being able to buy the best and best quality products so that her crop has a good development and health as well as an adequate harvest, she wants to have an important production in short order.  
She wants to use the income from the harvest she hopes to obtain for the wellbeing and studies of her family, to fulfill with some family goals, and to continue investing more in the crops. 
This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Heab

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Heab is a mother of a small child and she is 32 years old. Nowadays, she does rice farming and has been working as a factory worker for five years. She could make around 42,400KHR per day from her business. 

This is the first loan for her and she will take her loan portion to buy more farmland to expand her farming area. She hopes to improve her family’s living and keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to expand her farming area

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chola's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Battambang province, Chola is 48 years old and is a mother of four children. One of her children is in school and the others are too young to attend school. Nowadays, she sells grocery items and has been working for two years to support her family’s living. Through these sources of income, she earns about 120,300 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day.

Chola has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and has completely repaid her loans. She is now leading a group of three to apply for this new Kiva loan in order to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to expand her business bigger than before and keep her children in school via this loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She is a cocoa trader, mainly buying cocoa for selling. Jenifer started her business in 2012 with an aim of taking care of her family's needs, and she gets additional income from her cocoa garden.

Jenifer requests a loan to buy cocoa for selling. Her family's dreams are to educate her children to university level and building a good family house. Her business dream is expanding her cocoa business to new markets.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children two go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a stationery shop at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years, and she works six days a week. 

She has requested for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of reams of paper, carbon paper, staples etc Her major challenge includes power shortages which affect her efficiency. She aspires to buy a fast processing photocopy. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food, and rent for her shop and house.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of reams of paper, carbon paper, staples and other office and home stationary supplies

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is from Jrapi village, where she lives with her husband. They both are involved in farming. Their only son migrated to a neighbouring country to find a well paid job and sustain his parents' living.

So, to earn a daily living income, the only hope for Alvard and her husband is their farming business. They keep livestock of 8 cows, calves, one pig and hens. In their family yard Alvard and her husband also cultivate wheat and barley and grow fruit trees.

Alvard asks for this loan to purchase 5 piglets and to be able to enlarge the number of cattle. She plans to raise them and sell at a higher price in the coming winter season. Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses.

Alvard's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets to enlarge the farm and get more income for the family's living

loans.name: Mayimuna

texts.en:
Mayimuna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and she also takes care of additional family members.

She operates a kiosk at the market where she sells on a retail basis. Mayimuna has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil, and boxes of mineral water. Her major challenges include high transportation costs and electricity, which increases her operational costs.

Her goal is to build a residential house in future. Mayimuna would also like to start making snacks to supplement her income. She lives in a rented house with access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan'asabe Village. Martha joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.

In the past, Martha suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to feed her family and children. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Martha has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. Martha can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Mwanasiti owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other operators in her place of operation.
 
With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase two tanks of fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two tanks of fuel for resale

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 55 años de edad, que para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus ocho hijos se dedica al cultivo de una diversidad de flores de su región, ella tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, y para obtener mejores ingresos se dedica a la venta de frijoles, maíz y refacciones. Esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina por ser el cultivo de flores su mayor fuente de ingreso pues es así como se ha convertido en su prioridad, y ahora se ha dado cuenta que por la época de lluvia ella deberá aprovechar mejor sus tierras, pero para poder aprovecharlo necesita de semillas de flores, abono químico, orgánico, insecticidas y fungicidas por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir todos estos insumos.
Catarina espera contar con el préstamo para poder cultivar y obtener buenos ganancias y lo ahorrara para utilizarlo cuando ella carezca de dinero.
texts.en:
Catarina, 55, grows a diverse array of local flowers to earn money and support her 8 children. She has been doing this work for 10 years, and in order to increase her income she also sells beans, corn and spare parts. Her humble family lives in the community of Solola.

Since her flower crop is her largest source of income, it has become her top priority. She has realized that she should take advantage of the rainy season to improve her fields, but in order to do this she needs seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides. She is asking for a loan to help buy all of these inputs.

Catarina hopes to get the loan so that she can grow her crops and make good profits in order to save some money for when times are tough.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Reiman

texts.es: Reiman, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Reiman, 30, is married and lives with his wife and their son, who are his top priority. He plans to use his loan to buy good quality bean seeds with good germination, and organic fertilizers that will help to improve the conditions of his soil, along with other products for his crops. He also will pay laborers to help prepare the fields and prevent erosion from the rain, as well as to apply the products and help with the plantation once the crops are growing. This will ensure that he does a good job.

He wants to take advantage of good climatic and soil conditions in his region for growing beans, and also to put into practice several years of experience that he has with basic grains. He wants to buy the best quality products so that his crops develop healthily and he has a good harvest. In the short term, he wants to have good production so that he can use the profits from his harvest to improve the well-being and education of his family and meet their goals. He also wants to continue reinvesting in his crops.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from established banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Namita Group

texts.en:
Namita Group has been formed in the year 2015 at IRC village, Bhubaneswar, of the Khurda district, Odisha, India. There are five active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing business as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses. 

Ritanjali is one of them who takes a great role in her own development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is sitting in front of her group behind her tailoring machine with raised hand in the photo. She is about 48 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and two children.

Ritanjali has been engaged in the tailoring business at IRC village for the last five years. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 7,500 INR. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month. 

She planned to improve her business by means of a loan, which resulted in taking the loan and she will purchase a picot sewing machine from lthe ocal market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses, such as vegetable vending, milk business, and saree business,  and with this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a picot sewing machine

loans.name: Mother Mary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Anne. She is the Director of Mother Mary Junior School, a mixed school of 300 students in the rural area of Bukoyo in Iganga. 

Mother Mary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Mother Mary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. 

Anne ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system and provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Gauri

texts.en:
Gauri is a hardworking married woman from Raychenga, a small village in district Alipurduar in West Bengal. She is 32 years old and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Gauri’s husband is a farmer. Gauri is a homemaker but helps in her husband's agricultural activities in her free time. Both her son and daughter attend local school.

Her husband has been running his business of agriculture for years. They grow different crops and sell them in the market. Gauri wants to expand her business to generate more income for her family and to provide a good education to her children.

She plans to increase her agricultural yield by investing in better quality seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. She wants to grow paddies on their farmland because paddy is the staple food of West Bengal and there is a huge demand for this crop. But a lack of access to funds stands in the way of her implementing these plans. She is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will invest the loan money for paddy cultivation. She expects a good return from this cultivation. 

She is ready to work hard and provide the best education to her children. She has a dream to construct a concrete house for them.

Gauri is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivation of paddy.

loans.name: Sarayya Yohanna

texts.en: Sarayya Yohanna is a Babban Gona farmer from Dukko Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Sarayya Yohanna no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve her yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably.  Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sarayya Yohanna now has the opportunity to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and resell traditional local clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cocoa and bitenge cloth to sell

loans.name: Rina's Group

texts.en: Rina, who is a farmer, lives in the Sesan district of Steung Treng province. This 24-year-old man is a married father of a daughter who is too young to attend school. Rina grows cassava as the main source of his family’s income. He sometimes works as a paid worker in order to supplement his income. He has been involved in his job for ages. This is the first time for him to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Leading a group of two to get a loan, Rina is applying for a loan to buy cassava seeds. He hopes that he can earn more income to improve his living standard so it is much better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with seven kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Halima operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.


With the loan of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail products to sell in the market and gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment to use in his barber shop business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 45 years old, married and blessed with two children. She sells sugarcane and the business has been profitable. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of sugarcane to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income and be able to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her business by buying fruit to sell. Her hopes are to be successful in her business and be able to improve family living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugarcane to sell. She hopes this will enable her to get more income and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Golapa Group

texts.en:
Golapa Group was formed in the year 2015 at IRC village, Bhubaneswar, of Khurda district, Odisha, India. There are five active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses. 

Lusita is one of them who has taken a great role in her own development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is sitting in front of her group behind her tailoring machine with raised hand in the photo. She is about 24 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and one child.

Lusita has been engaged in the tailoring business at IRC village for the last four years. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence there are almost zero surpluses at the end of the month. 

She planned to improve her business by  means of a loan, which resulted in taking the loan, and she will purchase a picot sewing machine from the local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and to save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses such as a grocery shop, milk business, tailoring, and a battle shop.  With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a picot sewing machine

loans.name: Trahi Achyuta  (2) Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014 five self dependent women of Rental Basti, Bhubaneswar of Khurda district, Odisha, India formed a group named Trahi Achyuta (2).  Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and to develop their social source of revenue by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Susama is the most dynamic and vigorous lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a joint liability group. The exceptional lady, aged about 33 years, is sitting in front of their group members and behind her tailoring machine with raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high aspiration. Her family consists of her husband and three children.

For the last four years Susama has been engaged in tailoring with the help and full support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of INR 8,500 from her current occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. 

So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan. She will purchase a huge quantity of cloth and tailoring related items from the nearest market to prepare more and more dresses in a slot. Through this Susama hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house. 

The other four members of the group have also engaged themselves with different small businesses like tailoring, a green coconut shop, a vegetable shop,  a dairy firm, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of cloth and tailoring related items

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with 2 school-aged children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanasha operates a business selling khangas (women's wrap cloth) from her home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. In her area of operation, she faces the major challenge of seasonal sales fluctuations.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas to resell.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dukko Village. Nuhu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Nuhu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Nuhu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Nuhu can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Trahi Achyuta (1) Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014 five self dependent women of Rental Basti, Bhubaneswar of Khurda district, Odisha, India formed a group named Trahi Achyuta (1). The main objective is to expand their existing businesses and to develop their social relations by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Kuni is the most dynamic and vigorous lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a joint liability group. The exceptional lady, aged about 30 years, is sitting in front of their group members and behind her tailor machine with raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high aspiration. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last six years Kuni has been engaged in tailoring with the help and full support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of INR 8,000 from her current occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. 

So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan. She will purchase a huge quantity of cloth as well as tailoring related items from the nearest market to prepare more and more dresses in a slot. Through this Kuni hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house. 

The other four members of the group have also engaged themselves with different small businesses like tailoring, battle shop, dairy firm etc.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of cloth as well as tailoring related items

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband Sachin and three sons in Ramthenga village in Falakata, West Bengal in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud). One of her sons is in the carpentry business; the other two work for a private company on a daily wages basis.  Gita has received an education until grade eight and her husband studied up to grade five.

Her husband is a farmer. He has been in this profession for many years and owns a plot of land where he cultivates a variety of food crops. Gita plays a major role in helping her husband in all his farm activities. At present, they want to cultivate green chilies on their farmland. 

Gita wants to purchase the resources necessary to carry out sustainable agriculture with quality chili seeds, fertilizers, manure and other essential farm supplies. Gita is seeking a loan from Kiva via BJS. This will help them to grow chilies in bulk quantities. 

With the additional profit generated by chili cultivation, Gita hopes to purchase a plot of agricultural land. She is happy and thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessary farm supplies for growing chilies.

loans.name: Sidia

texts.es: Sidia  tiene la edad de 38 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos  actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar las gallinas y el alimento para las mismas. Ella desea vender los huevos a los vecinos y en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Sidia is 38 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children. She requests a loan to purchase materials to make a chicken coop and to buy chickens and food for them. She wants to sell eggs to neighbors and some businesses in order to generate better income. She hopes to be able to provide better quality of life and greater economic stability for her family, and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer. It is her first loan through FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans previously from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better services and much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials and chickens

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen, is a young farmer from Voxji village in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is married and is the father of a 2-year-old daughter. He also lives with his parents and brother, who are his main source of support in his agriculture business.
 
Armen raises livestock. He has 2 cows, 10 calves, 35 sheep, and 20 hens. He also grows potatoes in their family yard and earns income from their sale in the market. 

Armen's father is a good farmer who taught his 2 sons how to work with trees and grow high quality fruit. They have a big orchard where different fruit trees grow and yield apricots, cherries, plums, apples, and pears. They transport their harvest to Yerevan town where it is sold.
 
Armen has applied for his loan to pay for the renovation of his barn and purchase 7 piglets and 500 litres of fuel needed for land cultivation. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Armen's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them access markets and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his barn and purchase 7 piglets and 500 litres of fuel needed for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system and provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jaga Kalia Group

texts.en:
Jagakalia Group was started in the year 2014 at Baramunda, Bhubaneswar of Khurda district, Odisha, India. There are four active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their obtainable businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses. 

Anusa is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and in their group members’ employment improvement. She is sitting in the group with raised hand beside her tailoring machine in the photo. She is about 35 years old and living with her small family, her husband and two children. 

She has been engaged with the saree business in her own home of Baramunda for five years. Her husband is also helping her to support the business. Through the concerned business she earns a monthly income of 12,000 INR. Her opinion is that from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family in this urban area like Bhubaneswar. After that to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business.

Anusa plans to purchase a huge quality of modern sarees and other dress materials for kids and ladies as per demand of the customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for rebuilt of another shop and to provide better education to her children.

The other three members of the group are also smart at their professional and also actively engaged with different professional like beauty parlor, auto, and fast-food shop in the same society with this loan; they hope to make better their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quality of modern sarees and other dress materials for kids and ladies

loans.name: Maryamu Lami

texts.en: Maryamu Lami is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dukko Village. Maryamu Lami joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  In the past, Maryamu Lami suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Maryamu Lami has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Maryamu Lami can now ensure that her children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra, 27 years old, is a married housewife and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). They live in their own small house in Falakata in West Bengal. She lives there with her children and husband, Jagadish, age 45 years. Both husband and wife are unschooled and can only sign their names. Their children are students in different grades in the local village school.

Her husband is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables on their own farmland. They are facing so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate capital to successfully carry out the business activity and inadequate finances to educate their children and provide them with other basic necessities. The income from the agricultural activities is hardly sufficient for maintaining all the expenses of a four-member family. So, they have decided to cultivate maize on their farmland. They have chosen this crop, as it has a very good market demand.

Sumitra has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in their business. She will use the loan to buy maize seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessary resources for growing maize in their own field. It is a crop that is in demand all over West Bengal. She holds a positive view of succeeding with this business.

With the additional income from this business, she will be able to fulfill the basic necessities of her family and give a good education to her children. In the future, she dreams of buying more farmland with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary resources for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has 2 children, aged 15 and 5 years. He has 1 additional dependent whom he adopted when her parents died.  

In 2015, Ibrahim established his clothing materials business. He began his business because this is what he wanted as his occupation. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Ibrahim would like to take a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL which he requires to buy bales of different types of clothing material to resell. He hopes that this loan will help add stock and maximize profit.  

In the future, Ibrahim plans to finish his payments for land he acquired, which saves him from having to pay the high cost of rent. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of different types of cotton clothing material to resell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre trabajador y muy dedicado a su familia, el para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica  a la compra y venta de variedades, esta labor lo realiza el desde hace cuatro años.
Francisco con el afán de ofrecerle a los clientes mejores servicios y una amplia gama de productos a tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo para poder invertirlo en su negocio comprando productos como ollas, perfumes, recuerdos así satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Francisco sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para generar mejores ganancias y darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a hardworking man and very dedicated to his family. In order to generate income and raise his children, he has been buying and selling varieties of items for four years. 

Francisco is eager to offer customers better services and a broad range of products. He took the initiative to apply for a loan to invest in buying products such as pots, perfume, and souvenirs in order to better meet customer needs.

Francisco hopes to grow his business to generate better profits and provide education for his children.

loans.use: to buy products such as pots, perfume, and souvenirs.

loans.name: Begimai

texts.ru: Бегимай, 22 года, замужем, детей нет. У Бегимай среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, с 2013 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Бегимай, в хозяйстве имеется: корова, 7 овец, лошадь.  В общей сложности деятельность Бегимай приносит около 14,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Бегимай является участником группы "Буйга", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Бегимай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также накопить средства на постройку собственного дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Begimai is 22 years old, married, and doesn't have children. Begimai has a secondary education, and she has been raising animals since 2013 as the primary income for her family. Thanks to Begimai's hard work, her farm now has a cow, 7 sheep, and a horse. Altogether, Begimai's work brings in around 14,000 som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further expand her farm, Begimai has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. Begimai is a member of the "Buiga" group, which has another 2 members. Begimai plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further enlarge her farm, and also to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Morex

texts.en:
Morex is a 28-year-old woman living with her one child in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a vendor at markets, selling fresh foods, and she earns additional income from growing and selling cocoa. 

Morex is very hardworking but is challenged by inadequate capital. She hopes to buy land and build a house. She also hopes to educate her child up to the university level. 

Morex has requested a loan to increase her inventory of food stuffs so she can meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs, such as cassava, to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a stall and add more inventory of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer casada de 36 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estudian nivel primario y uno estudia básico, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Catarina su actividad económica es la compraventa y elaboración de ropa típica de su región, esta labor lo realiza ella porque es una buena fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia, el tiempo que Catarina tiene de ejercer esta labor es de siete años , este negocio se ubica en su casa de habitación.
Catarina solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la remodelación de su casa compra de puertas, laminas, pues actualmente su casa cuenta con unos desperfectos  por lo tanto es necesario la remodelación porque ya se acerca la época de lluvia.
Catarina sueña con poder construir una su cocina para tener un mejor lugar donde preparar los alimentos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Catarina is a married, 36-year-old woman.  She has a beautiful family of four children, three of whom are in elementary school, while the other is in middle school.  This humble family lives in the community of Nahuala.

Catarina makes a living buying, selling and making traditional clothing from her region.  She does this work because it is a good source of income for herself and her family.  Catarina has been performing this work for seven years, and the business is located in her home.

Catarina is requesting a loan to be able to remodel her house by purchasing doors and sheet metal, since currently her house has some areas of damage.  Therefore, it is necessary to remodel, since the rainy season is approaching.  Catarina dreams of being able to build a kitchen to have a better place where she can make food for her children.

loans.use: to purchase doors and sheet metal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a stall and add more stock for resale.

loans.name: Tony Angel

texts.es:
Tony, hace la petición de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas y herbicidas, para asegurarse de tener todo listo para sembrar maíz en la nueva temporada, le será de utilidad para continuar desarrollando sus actividades agrícolas y salir adelante con su familia.
Con el crédito anterior ha logrado tener una cosecha abundante, sus ingresos son mejores y tiene un estilo de vida más digno, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades para trabajar día con día.
texts.en:
Tony is applying for a new loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and herbicides to make sure that he has everything ready to plant corn next season.  It will help him to continue developing his agricultural profession and move forward in life with his family.

With the previous loan, he has been able to have a plentiful harvest, his income is better and he has a more decent quality of life.  So far, he has not had any difficulties with working day after day.

loans.use:
sembrar maíz en la nueva temporada
to purchase fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and herbicides to make sure that he has everything ready to plant corn next season

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, utilizo el crédito anterior para invertirlo en el cultivo de maíz, los resultados han sido positivos ya que la cosecha fue la esperada y ha tenido una leve mejoría en sus ingresos. Su familia tiene oportunidad de vivir en mejores condiciones.
Esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas para que se le facilite la siembra de maíz, de esta manera seguirá trabajando en el campo y mejorando las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
José used the previous loan to invest in the cultivation of corn.  The results have been positive, since the harvest was as he hoped and he has had a slight improvement in income.  His family has the opportunity to live in better conditions.

He is requesting a new loan to invest in agricultural supplies to sow corn.  In this way, he will continue working in the field and improving his family’s circumstances.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies to sow corn

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives with his mother and grandmother in the Poqrashen village of the Shirak region. He is an IT specialist by profession working in a local village company. Because his salary is not enough to cover the family's basic costs, Sargis also helps his mother and grandmother with their farm. They raise cattle and cultivate barley and potatoes. Sargis applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds to expand their cultivation and earn more income for the family.
 
Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Sargis's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds to expand their cultivation and earn more income for the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell in the market to earn more income.

loans.name: Shirinjon

texts.ru: Ширинчон из района Фархор. Ему 31 лет. Он женатый человек. У него трое детей. Жена швея. Она дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Ширинчон живет вместе отцом, матерью, женой и детьми. Его отец занимается таксистом. Ширинчон дехканин. Он занимается земледелием. Ширинчон до этого времени выращивал скота для себя, и больше времени он правел на земле.  Сейчас Он  набрал опыта для нового бизнеса, и решил заниматься купле продажам скота. Ширинчон планирует покупать скота и откармливать их несколько месяцев, потом перепродавать их на скотном рынке. Ширинчон, уверен в себе и верит в себе, что справится с новым бизнесом и станет успешным бизнесменом. Ему нужно только Ваша поддержка. Шириинчон по этой причине просит кредит.
texts.en:
Shirinjon is from the Farkhor region. He is 31 years old, and he is a married man. He has 3 children. His wife is a seamstress, and does dressmaking work from home. Shirinjon lives with his father, mother, wife, and children. His father works as a taxi driver. Shirinjon is a farmer, and he does agricultural work. Until now, Shirinjon raised livestock only for his own use, preferring to spend time working the earth. 

Now Shirinjon has the opportunity for a new business, and has decided to buy livestock for resale. He plans to buy livestock and fatten them for a few months, then resell them at the livestock market. Shirinjon is confident and believes that he will be able to manage this new business and become a successful businessman. He just needs your support. For this reason, Shirinjon is asking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock for his new business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from operating a retail shop. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village to the market. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a cow shed and buy animal feeds to increase milk production.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, requiere de un nuevo financiamiento por la oportunidad que le dan de surtir su inventario, comprara bebidas refrescantes, carnes, verduras, condimentos, golosinas, pan y otro tipo de mercadería para fortalecer la tienda.
Ha Mirian el préstamo anterior le ha dado resultados positivos en su negocio, puesto que se mantiene trabajando para ir cubriendo las necesidades de su familia y con las ganancias ha hecho reparaciones importantes en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirian needs new financing for the opportunity to stock her inventory.  She will purchase soft drinks, meat, vegetables, condiments, sweets, bread and other merchandise to bolster her store.

The previous loan provided Mirian with positive results in her business, since she continues working to meet her family’s needs.  With her earnings, she has made important repairs to her house.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, meat, vegetables, condiments, sweets, bread and other merchandise to bolster her store

loans.name: St. Francis Kigulu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Frank. He is the Director of Studies at St. Francis Kigulu Secondary School, a girls school in the Rural area of Busonga in Iganga with 300 students. St. Francis School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Francis School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Frank ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Iganga Top Care School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Paul. He is the Director of Iganga Top care Secondary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Iganga with 1,200 students. Iganga Top Care School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water-filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water-treatment systems with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Iganga Top Care School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Paul ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de todos estudian, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán.
Marta para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace diez años.
A Marta le gusta mucho con vivir con la naturaleza pero hasta estos días no ha tenido la posibilidad de comprar un terreno donde ella pueda cultivar, es por eso que le ha parecido una gran oportunidad de poder comprar un terreno  con cultivo de café que ahora le están ofreciendo, pero lamentablemente con el dinero que ella posee no es suficiente, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para ajustar el dinero y comprar su terreno.
Marta sueña con poder comprar el terreno y algún día construirle una casa a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 34 years old, married, and has a beautiful family of four children who are all students. This humble family lives in a community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán.

In order to generate income and to raise her children, Marta has been making traditional clothing from her region for ten years.

Marta really likes to live with nature. However, to this day, she has not been able to buy land where she can cultivate. She sees a great opportunity to buy land for coffee cultivation. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money. For that reason, she requests a loan to establish fund to buy the land.

Marta hopes to be able to buy the land and build a house for each of her children someday.

loans.use: to buy land with coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. A year and a half ago, she started her own business to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs, especially her children's yearly education fees. They have to settle those to make sure that they can benefit from the best education and a brighter future.

Hanady has 30 years of experience in the food business. She had to leave school during her intermediate level to start working to earn her living. She opened a snack where she got additional skills from her husband who runs his own restaurant too. Today, Hanady is working hard to develop her business through her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She will open an additional income business in parallel with her current snack. This will be a special cocktails and juices shop next to her snack so that she can provide her customers their full requested services. She hope to stay capable of expanding and developing her businesses in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To open an additional income business in parallel with her current. She will open a special cocktails and juices shop next to her snack, to provide her customers their full requested services

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking woman with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is mainly buying and selling foodstuffs, along with cocoa growing for supplementary income. She is in need of a loan to buy foodstuffs to sell to her increasing number of customers. She has a great desire of making bigger profits and becoming a prominent businesswoman in her area, although she complains of the difficulty of high transport costs, unpredictable weather changes and limited capital.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for eight years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to build a permanent business premise from home. She rents a house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Milagro Isabel

texts.es:
Milagro, ve en los créditos una herramienta efectiva para crecer con su negocio, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para comprar herbicidas y abono para darle un buen trato al cultivo de maíz, de esta manera seguirá teniendo alimento para su familia y tendrá la oportunidad de generar los ingresos necesarios para subsistir.
Con la utilización de créditos Milagro ha mejorado la productividad de su negocio, las circunstancias económicas están cambiando y sus deudas han disminuido considerablemente.
texts.en:
Milagro sees the loans as an effective tool to grow her business.  She is requesting new financing to purchase herbicides and fertilizer in order to tend well to her corn crop.  This way, she will continue to have food for her family and the opportunity to generate the income necessary to survive.

By utilizing the loans, Milagro has improved the productivity of her business, her financial circumstances are changing, and her debts have decreased considerably.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and fertilizer in order to tend well to her corn crop

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila, who is a 38-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Bichnigauri. She has a husband and pensioner mother-in-law. The only breadwinner in the family is Leila's husband, who is a tractor driver and gets 300 GEL fixed salary. The family finds it hard to have financial stability and make enough monthly income to cover all daily costs. 

Leila has a great desire to help her husband and lead the family effectively. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began. This is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poors Like Leila to get a chance for starting or re-starting business. 

Leila has a professional education of tailoring and wants to open a sewing workshop. She will start sewing various kinds of clothing and home products and will get private orders. After the workshop is opened, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as to expand the business in the future. With support of the Start Up program, Leila will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a sewing workshop and earn her own business income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for making clothes to sell to clients

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ZEduPads, which he will use as an educational resource to provide quality modern teaching and learning through ICT e-learning to the children at Primetime School.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María con una sonrisa en sus labios nos cuenta que inició su negocio motivada por una amiga que le sugirió elaborar comidas típicas de la Costa Caribe Colombiana; Pasabocas, Bollos (masa de maíz envuelta en hojas de mazorca) y Fritos (masa de maíz a la que se adiciona carne, pollo o queso y se fríe en aceite), tomo el consejo y hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada a la que espera a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. de lunes a viernes en su casa ubicada en un Barrio de Barranquilla y los fines de semana desde una tienda cerca de la localidad.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra al por mayor de maíz, aceite, queso y carne.  Al realizar sus compras por volúmenes podrá obtener mayores ganancias.  María es madre de un hijo y su meta familiar es comprar un apartamento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
With a smile on her face, María tells us that she started her business with motivation from a friend, who suggested that she make traditional food from the Caribbean coast of Colombia: pasabocas (snacks), bollos (cornmeal dough wrapped in corn husks), and fritos (cornmeal dough with beef, chicken or cheese, fried in oil).  She took this advice, and today, has five years of experience and a loyal customer base who expects her from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m., Monday through Friday, in her house located in the Barranquilla neighborhood.  On the weekends, she sets up at a store near the village.  

Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest it in the purchase of corn, oil, cheese and meat in bulk.  By making her bulk purchases, she will be able to obtain better profits.  María is the mother of one child and her goal for her family is to purchase an apartment to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, cheese and meat in bulk

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun is a mother of five children living in Battambang province. She is 51 years old. Nowadays, she does rice farming and works on other farms for a fee. She has been farming for 30 years. Her income is about 37,200 riels per day. She has been with VisionFund for seven cycles, and she has fully repaid her past loans. Those previous loans helped her to have a better house to stay in. 

Sokun is now leading a group of three to get a new Kiva loan. She will use her loan portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers and pay the labor fees for her farming. She hopes her family will have a better standard of living than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Ra'iesa

texts.en: Ra'iesa is a widow with three daughters. After her husband passed away, Ra'iesa started a grocery store to generate income for her daughters and enable them to resume their education. She requested a 1,000 Egyptian pound loan to buy products such as tea, oil and pasta.

loans.use: To buy products such as tea, oil and pasta.

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Srey Mom is 33 years old. She is the mother of two children: one of them is in school while the other one is too young to get into school. Srey Mom has earned her daily income via cassava growing and working as a paid worker for ten years. The sources of the family’s income bring in about 63,900 riels per day. 

Srey Mom has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid the loan. As the leader of a group of three, she will take out a new loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers, pay for plowing fees, and pay for labor fees. In the future, she expects to get more income to update her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay for plowing fees, and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
A survivor is always a survivor!

This is Gina, a 44 year old “sari-sari” (variety) store owner, who is married to Ronel, a tricycle driver. They reside in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo together with their children. They survived the wrath of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Gina’s variety store business was affected by the typhoon but with the help of her family, they were able to rebuild it.

Gina’s income from her store varies from time to time, as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has a wide variety of items and merchandise. Gina hopes to expand her business by adding to the selection of supplies in order to meet the demands of consumers. With that method, she would be able to boost her income and savings that she can use in their children’s education. She humbly seeks your help through a PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional supplies like groceries and drinks for her variety store. She is praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to a survivor like her, and eventually make her family enjoy a brighter and comfortable future.  

Gina meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like groceries and drinks for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
