Hovhannes is from the Mayisyan village of the Armavir region. He lives there with his wife, son and daughter. They are grown up and help Hovhannes with farming work. On the farm, Hovhannes and his family keep livestock of 5 calves and 20 hens. Hovhannes also cultivates wheat, potatoes and cabbage on his farm, and sells the gathered harvest in the market. 

Hovhannes has now applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds to increase the cultivation and gather more income for his family. Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Hovhannes's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds to increase the cultivation and gather more income for his family

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Iloilo, just like other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines, was hit hard by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Almost all of the businesses in those areas dwindled or went bankrupt. Entrepreneurs worked hard in the past one and one-half years to recover and rehabilitate their businesses. “Sari-sari” or variety stores were not exempted from that crisis. Frequent distribution of relief goods to Haiyan-affected communities almost crushed the variety stores, because the commodities that the people need every day were supplied to them through relief goods. It was several months after Haiyan when variety stores rose again. 

Corazon is one of those variety-store owners. Not only Haiyan affected her business. Her income diminishes also during school breaks or vacations. Now that the school has already begun, she needs additional capital to buy more stocks of grocery items and dry goods for sale in her variety store. This includes cookies, chips, candies, canned goods, sachets of toiletries, juice, soft drinks, beverages, and many others. She implores you for your kind support for a loan of PHP 30,000 to enable her to buy all of these items. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires for a bigger and more successful business.  

Corazon is married to Nelson and they have children. They work hard to support their daily expenses and children’s education. Corazon and her husband share a common dream that all their children will finish college and have a better living condition someday.

Corazon is a devoted member of CCT and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items and dry goods for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Edely

texts.en:
Rainy season is fast approaching in the Philippines. This season is difficult for fishermen and fish vendors. Practically, it’s dangerous for fishermen to go fishing. The scarcity of fish makes its price higher, and the fish vendors find it hard to afford. 

Edely, a dried fish vendor who resides in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, prepares for the upcoming rainy days. She wants to have additional capital of PhP 15,000 to buy volume quantity of fresh fish while it’s still cheap. She will dry it and sell it afterwards. This additional capital will keep her business running even during rainy season. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Edely is a widow with a child studying in college. Two or three years from now, she will be relieved of her child’s educational expenses. She can give full focus in her dream of improving her business. She is a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume quantity of fresh fish that she will dry and sell aftrewards

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 52 years old and married with four children.

Enriqueta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Enriqueta has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Enriqueta aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old, and is a  married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Jane has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 41, is a mother of five children, three of whom are in school. Mom lives in a rural area of the Battambang province. Her daily businesses are rice farming and selling grocery items. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 90,000 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds to do farming, she is now leading a group of four to take the first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to support her farming. She hopes to gets more income from business and the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to support her farming

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзада, 24 года, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, с 2013 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзады, в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 4 лошади. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. В общей сложности деятельность Нурзады приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Нурзада является участником группы "Буйга", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nurzada is 24 years old, married, and has a son. She has a secondary education, and has been rearing animals as her family's source of income since 2013. Thanks to Nurzada's hard work, her farm now has 2 cows and 4 horses. She sells milk on a daily basis. Overall, Nurzada's work brings in around 9,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to further expand her farm, Nurzada has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. Nurzada is a member of the "Buiga" group, which has another 2 members. Nurzada plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is a mother of two children and one of them is a university student. She is 43 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. 

For her living, she sells grocery items as the main source of her income, and her family also earns additional income through fishing. 

She is taking this first Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for her child's school fees. She hopes to see her child get a higher education and have a good job, which could help her to earn more money to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for his poultry business.

loans.name: Babylin

texts.en:
Iloilo, just like other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines, was hit hard by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Almost all businesses in those areas dwindled or were bankrupted. Entrepreneurs have worked hard in the past one and one-half years to recover and rehabilitate their businesses. “Sari-sari” or variety stores were not exempted from that crisis. Frequent distribution of relief goods to Haiyan affected communities almost crushed the variety stores, because the commodities that the people need everyday were supplied to them through relief goods. It was several months after Haiyan that variety stores rose again. 

Babylin is one of those variety store owners. Not only Haiyan affected her business. Her income diminishes also during school breaks or vacations. Now that school has already begun, she needs more stocks of variety store items like cookies, chips, candies, canned goods, sachets of toiletries, juice, soft drinks, beverages, and many others. She also plans to buy a refrigerator so she can have more bottled drinks for sale. She implores your kind support to enable her to buy all these needs in the amount of PHP 50,000. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business.

Babylin is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for sale in her variety store and procure a refrigerator for beverages.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
You can find the best “chicken inasal” or barbeque chicken in the provinces of Iloilo and Negros Occidental in the Western Visayas region of the Philippines. Customers keep coming back again and again due to its savory taste and aroma. This may be the reason why chicken inasal is one of the iconic products of these provinces. 

Aireen, 41, a resident of Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, chose the right business to venture into. She has run a chicken barbeque stand for almost twenty years and employs two helpers. Her husband, Wilfredo, also a food vendor, helps her in her business. They have three children to whom they want to dedicate all their efforts. The couple work hard to support their children’s education until its completion. It’s their aspiration to improve the quality of living for them. However sometimes they struggle financially if the income from their business becomes unstable. Due to proliferation of many barbeque stands in the area, the competition gets stiff. Aireen longs to run her business consistently to gain a better and steady income. You might be a blessing to her through this PHP 17,000 loan that she will use to buy additional ingredients for her chicken barbeque business. It will not just provide for their everyday needs but it will also boost her savings for her children’s future and education. It may also be another step to her vision of being the best food vendor ever.

Aireen meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her chicken barbeque business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She sells local brew at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and works six days a week. 

Florence has requested for a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy millet flour and sweet bananas to make the local brew. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises and rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy millet flour and sweet bananas to make a local brew.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old, married and supports four children. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to put up a stable stall and add more stock for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hope is to improve family living standards.

loans.use: to put up a stable stall and add more stock for resale.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan'asabe Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Iliya suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Iliya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick grows and sells cocoa, a business he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He earns additional income through a monthly pension from the Government. He works hard to meet his family's basic needs and dreams of continuing to educate his six children who are currently attending school. Fredrick is requesting a loan to help him to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en:
Bunly, 51, lives in Kampong Cham province and is the mother of five children. She farms rice and works on other farm to get more income to support her family. Her daily income is around 40,000 KHR per day (approx $US 9.70). She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid her loan. The previous loan helped her improve her house. 

Bunly is now applying to take a new loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan to purchase fertilizers for farming. Bunly expects to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Iganga S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Annet. She is the Head Teacher of Iganga Secondary School, a girls' school in the urban area of Iganga with 1,469 students. Iganga School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining three UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long term as the cost of buying firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase three UV water treatment system with 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Iganga School will repay its loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Annet ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Imara

texts.en: Imara is a widow with one son and one daughter. She works in an office but the income from her work does not cover the family's monthly expenses. Imara is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a machine to pluck chickens, and poultry such as chickens, ducks, and geese to guarantee better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry and a machine to pluck chickens.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 57 years old and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is the father of six children. He deals in growing, buying and selling cocoa, as well as getting additional income from selling food like maize, cassava and beans to get more income for the family. 

Peter works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land and expanding his cocoa growing to reap more income. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor, and inadequate capital to expand the business. Peter wants a loan to pay for labor charges for clearing and preparing cocoa gardens.

loans.use: to pay for labor to clear and prepare cocoa gardens.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 45 years old and married with seven children. She has been practicing farming for the last 15 years, earning KES 9,000 per month.

Paulina has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm tools and inputs to earn more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs.

loans.name: Vangilista

texts.en: Vangilista is a 36-year-old widow. She lost her husband in a motor vehicle accident, which left her with four children who attend school. She deals in cattle fattening and trade. She is requesting UGX 2,000,000 to help her pay school fees for the children who are in secondary school. Her challenge is that she does not earn much profit and yet her children are in high paying schools which leaves her with almost nothing to save. Her hope is to see herself educating all the children and later establishing her business to be sustainable. She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Samwiri

texts.en:
Samwiri is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom go to school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a butcher shop where he sells beef to the local people. Samwiri has been in that business since 2006. He also grows and sells cocoa to supplement his income from the butcher shop. 

Samwiri dreams of expanding his business but is limited by inadequate capital on top of high license fees. Samwiri has asked for a loan to buy cows for slaughtering and resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering and resale.

loans.name: Mwanamkuuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuuu is a married woman with three children in school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a business selling khangas (women's wraps), selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Hasifa sells used clothes at the market. She has been in this business for four years and works six days a week. She gets additional income from plaiting hair. 

Hasifa has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO of UGX 500,000 to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include fluctuating clothes prices. Her future goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is married and has no children. She started a falafel-and-fries project along with her aging mother who suffers from some bone issues. Wafaa requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a fryer to increase her sales and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fryer.

loans.name: Koiarchin

texts.en:
Koiarchin is a 44-year-old widow who lives in Tbilisi with her son. It's already one year since her husband has died and the family has had no source of income to cover even basic needs. Her husband's relatives help the family sometimes, but as a result they live in poverty. 

Koiarchin decided to lead the family on her own and start her own business. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Koiarchin applied to MFO Credo for credit. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

With the requested amount of $1500 USD, Koiarchin will start trading with greens. She will purchase fresh products everyday at wholesale prices and will sell it at increased prices at the local market. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program Koiarchin will be able to earn income and provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: to buy and resell greens at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber for use in construction and resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasha operates a stall selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transport costs.

She has requested KES 50,000 to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with eight adult children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Halima operates a stall selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transport costs.

She has requested KES 25,000 to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anwaar

texts.en: Anwar is married with one child, and lives in the same house as her husband's family. She started raising livestock in her house to make use of milk for domestic use and for sale in the local market. Anwar and her husband, who works in Cairo, dream of buying their own apartment so Anwar has requested a loan to buy more livestock such as goats and lambs. This will increase her monthly income and help her to save for her dream apartment.

loans.use: to buy more livestock such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Yesutsui Group

texts.en:
The group is located in Chorkor and is composed of four members. They sell soft drinks, plantains, cooked rice, yams and stew. 

Esther is a widow and all her children are grown up. She is 40 years old and cooks the plantains and stew. She started her business in 2011 to improve her standard of living, and also to be self-employed.

She is taking out the loan to buy plantains and other ingredients to prepare plantains and stew which she will sell to customers. Her clients are people from the same area. Her hope for the future is to build a firm business so that she can serve her customers better. She describes herself as a hardworking woman who appreciates the services that lenders offer.

The group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy plantains and other ingredients to prepare stew.

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru: Анор из города  Турсунзаде. Многие жители города Турсунзаде трудолюбивые, ответственные  и бизнесмены. Анор одна из них.  Ей 58 лет. В таком возрасте ей давно уже сидеть дома и отдыхать. Но Анор сильная женщина, и она уже не может сидеть без дел, потому что Анор с детства двигается вперед. Она любить трудиться.  У Анор муж и трое детей. Детям 28,22 и 17 лет. Ее дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Муж занимается таксистом в родном городе. Анор 10 лет занимается торговлей деятельностью. Она на рынке продает рис. У нее много видов риса. Анор планирует расширить деятельность путем увеличения товарооборот. Для увеличения товарооборот она хочет перевозить рис. Для перевоза нужны деньги, но у Анор их нет. И она обратилась за кредитом. Анор будет очень рада на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Anor is from Tursunzoda.  Many residents of this city are hardworking and responsible businesspeople.  Anor, age 58, is one of them.  At her age, she could have slowed down already to just stay at home.  But Anor is a strong woman, who cannot sit still.  Ever since she was a child, she has always been moving forward.  Anor loves to work.  She is married and the mother of three children who are 28, 22 and 17 years old.  Her children are now grown up and independent.  Her husband works as a taxi driver in his native city.  

Anor is involved in retail business, selling rice at the market.  She carries many varieties of rice.  She is now planning to increase her turnover in order to expand her activity.  To do so, she needs to bring in rice.  And for this, she needs money, which she doesn't have at the moment.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  She will be very happy to receive your support.

loans.use: to increase her turnover and to bring in rice to sell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 32 years old and from the Akhalkalaki district. He lives with his parents. His father works in a private company and gets a small monthly income, and his mother gets orders and bakes cakes to generate income. 

Artur has decided to start a business to supplement his income, but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. Artur is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Artur will use his loan to start a car wash. He already owns a space for this business, he will purchase essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. Artur's new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to open a car wash

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 29-year-old widow from Minia. She lives with her father who works as a farmer. 

Elham started a grocery store project to help him with the family income. She requested a 5,000 Egypt Pound (EGP) loan to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta, and oil.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta, and oil.

loans.name: Khakimahon

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Хакимахон. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Хакимахон добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду более 15 лет назад и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело.
 Хакимахон в этом году исполнилось 31 лет. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде с маленькими детьми. К сожалению, её муж в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи – он на заработках в Российской Федерации, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги. 
В швейном деле Хакимахон нравится ежедневный доход. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и приобрести много клиентов.
texts.en:
Meet Khakimahon.  She works as a seamstress, sewing traditional women's dresses at home. She enjoys sewing at home.  Khakimahon is a kind and intelligent woman, and she works very well.  She learned how to design and sew women's clothes more than 15 years ago, and she has pursued her favorite activity since then.

Khakimahon turned 31 this year.  She lives in the city of Tursunzoda with her young children.  Unfortunately, her husband is currently far from the family; he is making a living in the Russian Federation.  Every month he sends money home.  Khakimahon enjoys sewing for the daily earnings that she makes.  She is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine, improve her working conditions, and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Bhado

texts.en:
Bhado is 26 years old, married and the mother of one small daughter. She resides with her small family in Falakata in West Bengal. 

Bhado and her husband have been engaged in cultivation for years. They sell their harvested product in the market. As this agribusiness is the only source of income for the family, they need to develop their business. But they do not have sufficient capital. They need money to invest in their business. They have decided to grow paddy on their farmland.

Bhado is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase better paddy seeds, fertilizer, manure and other farm supplies to grow paddy. Bhado hopes this loan will give a boost to their business. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies to grow paddy on her farmland.

loans.name: Burma

texts.ru: Бурма, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, все активно помогают по хозяйству. У Бурмы средне-специальное образование, сельским хозяйством занимается с 1995 года. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 9 коров, 45 овец. Также на 3,25 Га земли она с семьей выращивает картофель, люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход Бурмы составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). Бурма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Бурма планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и накопить средства на ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Burma is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three children who all actively help her with the farm work.  Burma has a specialized secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture since 1995.  She currently has nine cows and 45 sheep on her farm.  On 3.25 hectares of land, she and her family also grow potatoes and alfalfa for domestic use on the farm and also for resale.  Burma makes an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock and increase the size of her herd.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business and to save enough money to renovate a barn.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
She is married with eight children. They all live in a four bedroom house in Bamenda, in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, which have been sickness, death and inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and cater for her family's needs.

With this new loan that she has requested she will buy piglets, fowl and feed. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in the agricultural field for a long time. With this business activity the community will benefit from her activity as it will provide food for the population and manure for gardeners in the local community.

With the profit made from this loan, she will pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes for resale to his customers

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a rural housewife from Raychenga village in the district of Alipurduar. She is 25 years old and attended school till grade seven. Her poor parents could not provide more education to her. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Both are students in local primary schools. Her husband Subhash is engaged in an agribusiness. They live in their own small mud house.

Kalpana and her husband work hard on his farmland and grow different vegetables like beans, gourds, cabbages, and cauliflower. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

In order to earn more profit from this agribusiness, they want to start green chilli cultivation on their farmland. Kalpana heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and decided to take a loan to buy chilli seeds, good quality fertilizers, manure and other farm supplies.

They hope this business will provide them a good profit, which will help them to bear the household expenses of their family and at the same time, help them to provide a better education for their children.

In the future, they aspire to buy more cultivable land. Kalpana sincerely appreciate the support of the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for cultivation of green chilies.

loans.name: Mayarani

texts.en:
Mayarani is a woman, 26 years of age, who lives in Falakata with her husband and two daughters. She has an elementary education, and her husband studied up to 9th grade. Both her daughters attend the village primary school. They live in a remote village, Raychenga in Alipurduar district, in their own kachha house (a house made of straw, tin, bamboo and mud).

Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates different kinds of vegetable crops, fruits, etc., and sells them in the local market. They are from a humble family with scarce economic resources. 

Due to their low income, Mayarani is unable to manage her family expenses properly. Her husband is struggling hard all day, but fails to earn according to their expectations, so Mayarani requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to purchase saplings, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessary farm supplies for cultivating bananas.

Mayarani is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target of fulfilling the villagers' great demand for bananas. She hopes to upgrade her financial status with the profit of her business. In the future she dreams of acquiring more agricultural land.

Mayarani is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for banana cultivation.

loans.name: Ajida

texts.en:
Dairy cows are valuable assets, supporting rural poor women to earn a decent living. Ajida is a resident of Baganbari village in Falakata. She runs a small dairy farm. She is 25 years old, married and a mother of a young son. Her husband is engaged in vegetable cultivation.

Ajida started the farm with one cow. She sells milk in the neighbouring households and to different tea vendors.  To make additional income, she also sells cattle by-products like cow dung. 

Ajida is a very enterprising woman; she always looks for opportunities. Within a very short period she has become successful in her small trade. She has achieved a good list of clientele which is increasing day-by-day.  Ajida is fully equipped to be a successful entrepreneur and she is taking a further step of seeking a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase another dairy cow. Her major challenge is raising funds. Most of her income is spent paying for expensive farm inputs and her household expenses.  She hopes the loan will help her to fulfill her desire.

The additional income will go into purchasing one Toto, a battery-operated auto rickshaw, which she plans to give on hire for additional income. Her dream will be achieved the day when her family get a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for the expansion of her dairy business.

loans.name: Ajima

texts.en:
Ajima lives in a small village called Baganbari in Falakata in West Bengal.  She is 22 years old and married, with a small son. Her husband runs a poultry farm. They live in their partly concrete house. 

Ajima's husband raises and sells chickens.  Ajima helps her husband in the business. Despite their considerable efforts, they face difficulties due to the high price of supplies and other expenses of maintaining the farm.  The income from this business is not sufficient to meet the daily requirements of the family. Moreover they face different problems like diseases caused by insects especially in the summer season and tough competition from other poultry farm owners. In order to avoid these, Ajima and her husband would like to expand their business. So Ajima is applying for a business loan from Kiva via BJS.

Ajima will use the loan to buy chicks along with their medicines and fodder. She hopes this will expand her business.  Both she and her husband will mutually develop their business and meet their social needs. 

Ajima heartily thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, fodder and medicine for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She is a vendor of native delicacies within her local community. Gloria also raises hogs to have an additional source of income.

She aims to increase the kilograms of native delicacies she offers as she has many orders but her capital is not enough. With regard to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 which will allow her to buy 20 kilograms of glutinous rice, flour, cassava and sugar. 

Gloria hopes that this amount of loan will enable her to keep her business progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy 20 kilograms of glutinous rice, flour, cassava and sugar.

loans.name: Dzhumakul

texts.ru: Джумакуль, 62 года, вдова, есть сын. Джумакуль работает врачом -консультантом в аптеке, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Джумакуль в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 8 коров, 80 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА, где Джумакуль выращивает люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 26,000 сом (KGS), с учетом заработной платы и пенсии. Она очень трудолюбивая и берется за любую работу, так как доходов катастрофически не хватает. Джумакуль в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для разведения. Доходы от кредита она вложит в расширение бизнеса и улучшение материального благосостояния.
texts.en: Dzhumakul is 62 years old, a widow, and she has one son.  She works as a consulting physician in a pharmacy.  As an additional source of income for her family she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1995.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has eight cows and 80 sheep on her farm.  She also grows alfalfa for resale on one hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 26,000 som (KGS), including her salary and pension.  Dzhumakul is very hardworking and would take up any job because her earnings are vastly insufficient.  In order to further grow her business, Dzhumakul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows for breeding.  She will use the earnings from her loan to expand her business and improve her material conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two cows in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with her son and husband in Borjomi district. Her husband works at a local bakery and gets a monthly salary. 

Lela is unemployed. She owns a flat and wants to rent it out in order to get a stable income. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,800 USD. 

With the received credit she will renovate a flat and will rent it out. She will be able to receive a rent every month and improve the living conditions of her family. Lela awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out to get income.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a 32-year-old married woman. Her small family is comprised of her husband Nirod and two sons. She lives with them in a small village named Raychenga in Falakata, West Bengal. They live in a small mud hut. She alternates her household activities with work in her husband's business. 

Her husband is engaged with an agribusiness, cultivating different seasonal crops with the help of Anima. Anima wants to increase their business. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner) to buy better quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She and her husband plan to grow paddy on their farmland as this is a very profitable crop in West Bengal. 

She wants to educate her sons and improve her standard of living, for which she is ready to work hard. With the profits she wants to fulfill her dream of constructing a concrete house for them.

Anima is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 44 years old and is from Kobuleti district. He is married and lives with his wife and son. Gocha gets orders to paint houses and generates income. 

As the income is not stable and not enough for the family, Gocha decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 500 USD. 

With the received credit Gocha will install gas equipment in his car and will serve people as a taxi driver. Gocha will be able to increase the family income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Khursida

texts.en:
Khursida is a 24-year-old young entrepreneur from Falakata, West Bengal. Her family is comprised of her husband and two little sons. Her sons are pre-schoolers. In her young age, Khursida received very limited education (till 5th grade) due to her family's financial issues. 

Khursida's husband is a driver by profession.  His income is hardly enough to provide for the family. In order to provide additional income, Khursida is involved in animal husbandry. She has one cow which adds a little financial assistance to the family. She sells milk in her neighborhood. She is a very active lady, who wants some extra income out of her own efforts. She wants to develop her business to raise her family income. She has chosen this because milk is in high demand in the market. 

Khursida has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a dairy cow. She hopes that this will increase her business to give a decent lifestyle to her family. Khursida wants to save money from her profit to purchase more cows in the future.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her milk selling business.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.es:
Suzana es una joven de 21 años de edad es soltera vive junto a su hija de cuatro años en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Suzana con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  al tejido de ropa típica, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace  cuatro años.
Suzana desde hace algunos días ha tenido la preocupación de remodelar su casa, pero lamentablemente esto no ha sido posible porque no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar maderas por docenas y cambiar la madera de su casa.
Suzana sueña con construir su casa de block y poder instalar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Suzana is 21 years old, single and lives with her four-year-old daughter in a community in Nahualá.

In order to earn an income and support her family, Suzana works producing knitted clothes that are typical to the local area. She has been doing this work for four years. 

For some time, now, Suzana has been worried about remodelling her house but she cannot do this as she does not have enough money. Suzana is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy wood in bulk and replace wood in her home.

Suzana dreams of building a house with bricks and opening and small grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk in order to remodel her house.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven talentosa, emprendedora, una mujer que aterrizada y buena administradora, a su corta edad de tan solo 20 años monto un negocio de venta de electrodomésticos, paga arriendo y tiene muy bien estudiado la zona ya que su producto estrella es la báscula, ya que este producto lo buscan mucho pequeños empresarios que montan su negocio de venta de verduras, carnicera entre otros productos y buscan como proveedora a Daniela.

Inicio la empresa con un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia la cual planea dársela a su madre, ese es su gran sueño y por ello trabaja cada día con mucho entusiasmo.

Con la intención de crecer y ser reconocida en el sector Daniela quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de básculas digitales en todos los tamaños y productos de cómputo, tales como; mouse, teclado, cables, cargadores, entre otros.
texts.en:
Daniela is a talented and enterprising young woman. She is down-to-earth and a good manager and, at just 20 years old, started her own business selling electrical appliances. She pays her rent and has studied the area where she works. Her star product is the weighing scale, which many small-business owners need in order to sell vegetables, meat and other products, and which they come to buy from Daniela.

Daniela started the business when she dreamed of buying a house that she could gift to her mother. This is still her big dream and so Daniela is enthusiastic in her work every day.

In order to expand the business and be well-known in the local area, Daniela is applying for a loan in order to buy digital scales of all sizes, and computer products such as mouses, keyboards, cables, chargers and more.

loans.use: to buy digital scales of all sizes, and computer products such as mouses, keyboards, cables, chargers and more.

loans.name: Claudia Cristina

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven de 24 años de edad, no tiene hijos ni pareja, vive con su padres y es la fuente principal de ingresos en su hogar.

Claudia tiene un negocio de salón de belleza en el cual ofrece un empleo, ha estado recogiendo dinero para ir modificándolo puesto que empezó solo con 4 paredes y una silla de motilar y poco a poco se ha notado el cambio y el progreso que lleva en este poco tiempo de operación.

El proyecto a futuro de Claudia es tener un spa de belleza, poder comprar una vivienda propia y un vehículo para conocer Colombia junto con su familia. 

Claudia quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de surtido en todo el tema de tratamientos capilares, desea invertir el dinero en compra de cremas, tintas, shampo, esmaltes, gel, entre otros, productos en cantidades por docena).

Este préstamo le ayuda a tener un surtido para montar una vitrina y vender los productos que usa en sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia, aged 24, has no partner or children. She lives with her parents and is the main earner for her family. 

Claudia has a beauty salon, which she has been saving money to improve. Although she began with just four walls and a hairdressing chair, little by little she has made improvements and has seen real progress in the short time that she has been operating. 

In the future, Claudia hopes to have a beauty salon and to buy her own home and a vehicle, so that she can explore Colombia with her family. 

Claudia has requested a loan to expand her stock of hair products, and wants to invest in creams, dyes, shampoo, nail varnish and gel, which she will buy in packs of a dozen. 

This loan will help her to have sufficient stock to display in the store window, and to sell products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy creams, dye, shampoo, nail varnish, and gel, among other products, in packs of twelve.

loans.name: Mbah Evodia

texts.en:
She is married with six children; one of her children is not yet fifteen years old. They live in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 

She faces many problems such as inadequate capital to operate her business, and the deaths of her mother, brother and husband. She has repaid three loans and will use this new loan to expand her restaurant business to buy ingredients used to fry “gateaux” such as sugar, flour, yeast, vegetable oil, beans, rice, sachet tomatoes, maize and fire wood. 

She holds a positive view of her business and believes that she can succeed because she has experience, regular customers, and she supplies food for birthdays and weddings. Her business provides the community with a regular supply of food at cheaper rates. 

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children by providing them with all the necessities needed in school, she will care for her family, buy farm seedlings for her small garden in the compound, and also save some for future investments. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil, flour, beans, corn, and rice.

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Love. It consists of five women from Chorkor, Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of GHS 6,500 from ID-Ghana. They are selling second-hand clothing, sewing accessories, cosmetics and ladies' foot wear. 

Esther is a 60-year-old single woman with grown-up children who live on their own. Esther covers the expenses and therefore she has to work so that she can fulfill her responsibilities. Esther will use her share of the loan to purchase clothing and sell it to her customers. She will also buy clothing from the main market and sell to customers door-to-door. 

Esther is requesting a loan of GHS 2,000 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase enough and respond to her current customers' needs. The members will use group pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Amizero Group

texts.en:
Vasta is a group leader, aged 58. She is married with three children aged between 18 and 34 years; one of them goes to school. 

The group is called Amizero which means “Trust” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future and make it better. 

She owns a shop and has been doing in this business for the past 42 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt, biscuits and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, biscuits and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 30 years old. She is a single mother of 2 kids and she has her own house. 

Nadia works as a graphic designer for a little private company. She would like to work by herself and she needs a loan to buy paper, ink and other inputs used in graphic design. 

She hopes you can help her because she has experience and she is responsible. In addition, she is capable of managing her own business. As you can see in the picture, Nadia is at her house ready to start her work.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and other inputs used in graphic design.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, onions, bags of rice.

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que estos le dan, en esta oportunidad lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá sembrar granos básicos, su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
El crédito anterior le permitido tener una cosecha abundante y dar mejores cuidados a los cerdos, manifiesta que sus clientes están satisfechos y los ingresos han mejorado en gran manera, su grupo familiar se mantiene igual y hasta la fecha no tiene limitantes para continuar trabajando en el campo.
texts.en:
Thanks to the positive results of previous loans, José is requesting a new loan, which he will use to buy agricultural supplies to plant basic grains. His objective is to continue working to support his household. 

The previous loan ensured that he had an abundant crop, and was able to provide better care for his pigs, which in turn meant satisfied clients and significantly increased his earnings. His family situation has not changed, and he can continue working in the fields.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to grow basic grains

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil who is 21 years old, lives in Samtredia district. He has only a sister and the family has no source of income and lives in poverty. They require financial support to cover even basic needs. 

Avtandil decided to start his own business and requested a loan. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start-Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

Avtandil plans to purchase building materials and make a car park. He will get daily income from the new business and will be able to tackle the financial difficulties. 

Avtandil and his sister rely on the good will of lenders and will be very thankful for the chance of well-being.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and open a car park.

loans.name: Rock Of Ages Group

texts.en:
The group Rock of Ages is located in Chorkor, Accra, Ghana and is a group of five very active women who, above all, want to better their quality of life. They are selling underwear, noodles, grocery, pastries and doing pedicures. 

Felicia is 52 years old and married with one dependent child who is 15 years. She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a second loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Chorkor branch. Felicia sells noodles. Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy more noodles to cover all of her customers' demands because without more investment capital, she feels that her own income is not sufficient. 

Besides the loans, Felicia and the other members of Rock of Ages also benefit from a combination of loans and education (training). The loan officer and the training officer share timely and useful information with the members on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The members learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gain essential knowledge about business planning, customer service, marketing and pricing. All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.

loans.use: To buy more noodles to cover all of her customers' demands.

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en:
Cherlita is 44 years old and has three children.  Cherlita is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherlita requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cherlita has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherlita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Deolfa

texts.en:
Deolfa is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Deolfa has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Deolfa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to urchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains.

Susan has been in this business for 38 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a buy and sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with ten children.

She earns a living by  in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice.

Erlinda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family, she has two children who are in school. Jocelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
This ladies are part of the group called Trust in God and it is located in Chorkor-Accra, Ghana and is a group of two very active women who, above all, want to better their quality of life. They are selling sandals and rice. Charllote is 44 years old and a married woman of one child, 2 years old. She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a tenth loan cycle. Charllote sells rice. Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy different bags sizes of rice to cover all of her customer demand because without more investment capital, she feels that her own income is not sufficient. 

Besides the loans, Charllote and the other members of trust in God also benefit from a combination of loans and education (training). The loan officer and the training officer share timely and useful information with the members on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene, and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The members learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gaining essential knowledge about business planning, customer service, marketing and pricing. All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.

loans.use: To buy different bags sizes of rice and also sandals to cover all of her customer demand.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her business

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en: These members are part of the group called God is Great who are beginning their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They are made up of two women who are into the sale of charcoal and a a dress maker. The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs. One of the group members is Shietu. She says that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago, at the invitation of of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, Shietu has a business in the sale of charcoal. She began this business with the sixth loan that she obtained through ID-Ghana. The loan that she will obtain this time is for an increase in capital to be used for the purchase of more charcoal from the wholesalers and sell to customers. She will sell the charcoal to her clients, door to door. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to assist her family, since she is married and has children. When she was asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal from the wholesalers and sell to customers.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional insecticide and other farm supplies and materials.

Emelyn has been farming rice for 17 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional insecticide and other farm supplies and materials

loans.name: Siphan

texts.en:
Siphan, 26, lives in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amelia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruits and vegetables business.

Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en:
Ilda is 26 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $ 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her second hand stall in 2002 with her own working capital of $ 100. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts and children's wear. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts and children's wear.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un hombre de 46 años activo y carismático, inicio en el año 2008 un negocio de distribución de papas en bultos con el cual ha mejorado las condiciones de vivienda en su hogar conformado por él, su pareja y dos hijos.

Inicio su trabajo por vocación al trabajo independiente, por necesidad económica, por buscar una mejor estabilidad en su hogar, por permitirse soñar, pensar que puede haber un mejor futuro y que lo puede forjar con sus manos por esas razones fue que Leonardo busco un horizonte como empresario.

Leonardo quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido papa en bultos directamente de las veredas, quiere aumentar su pedido y ofrecer sus servicios a grandes proveedores, si concreta un negocio y se convierte en proveedor tendrá trabajo por un buen periodo de tiempo, su familia, su negocio y su entorno se verán gratamente agradecidos y beneficiados.
texts.en:
Leonardo, aged 46, is an active and charismatic man. In 2008, he set up his own business selling bags of potatoes, and the earnings have allowed him to improve the living conditions of his family (himself, his wife and their two children).

He began the business because he believes in working independently, as well as out of economic necessity and in order to provide stability in his home. He wants to be able to dream, and to believe that he can mold a better future with his own hands. For these reasons, Leonardo chose a new path as a businessman.

Leonardo is requesting a loan to buy a range of bags of potatoes directly from the growers. He wants to increase his orders, and to provide his services to big suppliers. If his business is successful and he can become a supplier, he will have work for a long period of time, and his family, his business and his extended family will benefit and be very grateful.

loans.use: to buy a range of bags of potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, straw, and raffia to make hats

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Koniba est la cliente qui tient les cornes du bélier en main.
Agée de vingt-trois ans (23 ans), Koniba est une emboucheuse malienne des ovins. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants (âgés de 06 à 01an). Koniba rêve dans les jours à venir d’acheter pour ses enfants des béliers des bœufs et construire dans une ville. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais elle se débrouille mieux dans ses activités. Koniba a fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir ses activités. Avec son prêt elle achète dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone des béliers pour les engraisser et des feuilles de (Kinkéliba). Elle fait ses ventes  dans la foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Koniba fait des bénéfices de 46 000FCFA. Koniba fait l’embouche des ovins depuis deux  ans (02ans). Grâce aux prêts du RMCR, elle mène bien ses activités. Ce qui lui plait dans ces activités en est qu’elle y génère assez d’intérêt. Elle ne se plaint pas pour le déroulement de son activité.
texts.en:
Koniba is the client who is holding the ram [in the photo]. She is 23 years old and is a Malian livestock farmer. She is married and the mother of two children (who are one and six years old). She dreams one day to buy rams and cows for her children and to build [a house] in the village. She did not have the chance to go to school, but she does well with her work.

Koniba has been raising livestock for two years. She joined RMCR to support this work. With this loan, she is going to buy rams to fatten and Kinkeliba leaves in the weekly markets in her area. 

She makes her resales in the area's weekly markets. Koniba makes an earning of 46,000 francs CFA. 

Thanks to RMCR loans, she manages well in her work. She enjoys the work, because it is generates enough income. She doesn't complain about her work.

loans.use: to buy rams to resell

loans.name: Rivomanantsoa

texts.fr:
Rivomanantsoa est un jeune homme de 31 ans. Il vit avec sa femme dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Rivomanantsao exerce une activité de vente de chaussures depuis maintenant 5 ans. Il a aujourd’hui un stand au grand marché de la ville où il propose à sa clientèle divers types de chaussures (baskets, sandales, chaussures de ville…) à destination des femmes, des hommes ainsi que des enfants.
Cela fait maintenant 2 ans qu’il est partenaire de Vahatra. Les différents prêts obtenus lui ont permis d’augmenter son capital ainsi que le volume de son activité en proposant toujours plus de choix à sa clientèle.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, il a déjà pu améliorer le quotidien de son foyer en équipant son logement d’un salon (canapé et fauteuils). Il espère, à moyen terme, effectuer suffisamment d’épargne pour acquérir un terrain sur lequel il rêve de pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Rivomanantsoa is a young 31-year-old man. He lives with his wife in the urban area of Antsirabe, on the high plateaux of Madagascar. The couple does not yet have any children. 

Rivomanantsoa has worked selling shoes for five years. Today, he has a stand in the grand market in the town, where he sells various types of shoes (basketball shoes, sandals, city shoes, etc.) to men, women, and children.

It has been two years that he has been a partner with Vahatra. The different loans that he has received have allowed him to increase his capital and therefore to increase the volume of his business by always having more choices for his customers. 

With the earnings from this business, he has already been able to improve his household's daily life by buying living room furniture (a sofa and two armchairs).

He hopes, in the not so distant future, to be able to save enough to buy a piece of land, where he dreams of building a proper house.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Vololonirina

texts.fr:
Vololonirina est une femme de 34 ans. Elle est divorcée et élève seule son enfant, encore scolarisé,  dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches. Cela fait maintenant 8 ans qu’elle gère sa propre épicerie où elle propose divers articles d’utilisation courante (produits hygiéniques, piles, divers produits alimentaires…).
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 2 ans ce qui lui a permis d’augmenter et d’élargir significativement la gamme de produits proposés à la vente.  Les bénéfices de son commerce lui ont  permis d’améliorer les équipements nécessaires à son activité. Ainsi, elle a pu faire l’acquisition d’une balance et d’une vitrine. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock de marchandises et plus particulièrement les produits de première nécessité tels que l’huile, le riz, la farine, les haricots.
Vololonirina est une femme courageuse et responsable qui s’est donné comme objectif d’assurer au mieux l’éducation de son enfant, elle rêve de pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Vololonirina is 34 years old, divorced, and raises her only child, who still goes to school, in the urban area of Antsirabe, on the high plateaux of Madagascar. 

She has for eight years now been managing her own grocery store where she sells various everyday items (personal hygiene products, batteries, various food goods, etc.). 

Vololonirina has been a partner with Vahatra for two years, which has allowed her to significantly expand the range of products she sells. Earnings from her business allowed her to make improvements to her shop and to buy a balance and a showcase. 

With this new loan, she plans to renew her stock, especially basic foodstuffs, such as oil, rice, flour, and beans. 

Vololonirina is a brave and responsible woman who has given herself the goal of better ensuring her child's education. She dreams to be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy food products, such as rice, beans, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y tambien la socia vende juguetes como muñecas y carros, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member makes a living selling clothes and also sells toys, such as dolls and cars. The member sells trousers, blouses and T-shirts and has been doing this for several years now. The business is going well and her dream is to have a shop. The member is requesting a loan to buy shoes, T-shirts, sweaters and blouses.

The member is happy to be receiving this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, T-shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives in Nahapetavan village of the Shirak region with her husband.

They are both farmers, with 30 years of experience. They keep two cows and four calves as well as cultivating wheat, barley and potatoes. Rita's husband sells the gathered harvest in the local market.

The loan requested is for investing in the farm and to make it sustainable. Rita asks lenders to support her to pay for renovation of the barn and to purchase potato seeds for land cultivation.

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Rita's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for barn renovation and potato seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is married and works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years now.

Celestina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She has an used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell to customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. Ma. Luz hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor's daughter Honey Valerie is studying for a bachelor of science in architecture. She is currently in the second year of this five-year course.

Leonor needs PHP 15,000 to pay Honey Valerie's tuition fees for the first semester of the 2015-2016 school year. Honey Valerie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Volatiana

texts.fr:
Volatiana est une femme de 41 ans qui élève son enfant, encore scolarisé, avec son mari dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches. Cela fait maintenant plus d’une dizaine d’années qu’elle gère sa propre épicerie-gargote où elle propose divers produits de consommation courante (couches, ampoules, biscuits, bonbons, vinaigre, conserves, beignets…)
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 6 ans. Les prêts successifs qu’elle a obtenus lui ont permis de consolider significativement son capital. Sa solide expérience dans ce secteur ainsi que sa capacité d’analyse et de projection lui permettent d’avoir bien conscience de la nécessité d’augmenter et de diversifier sa marchandise pour se démarquer de la concurrence, assez nombreuse dans son quartier et ainsi fidéliser sa clientèle.
