Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock mais également élargir sa marchandise à des produits frais. Pour cela, elle prévoit d’acheter des jus et des produits laitiers.
Jusqu’à présent, grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, elle parvient à assurer le quotidien de sa famille et la scolarité de son enfant. Elle a également réussi à réaliser les travaux de réhabilitation de sa maison. Elle espère un jour devenir grossiste pour pouvoir garantir plus solidement  la sécurité et l’avenir de son foyer.
texts.en:
Volatiana is 41 years old. She raises her child, who is currently receiving an education, with her husband in the urban commune of Antsirabe in the highlands of Madagascar. For almost 12 years, she has been running her own small grocery store/restaurant where she sells various day-to-day products (diapers, bulbs, biscuits, sweets, vinegar, jams, doughnuts...)

She has been a Vahatra partner for six years. The successive loans she has obtained have allowed her to significantly consolidate her capital. Her solid experience in this sector, as well as her keen abilities to analyse and plan for the future, allow her to see the need to increase and diversify her stock in order to stand out from the competition in her local area so she can establish customer loyalty. With this new loan, she not only plans to refresh her stock, but also to expand the number of fresh produce she offers. She plans on purchasing juices and dairy products to this end.

Up until now, thanks to the profits from her business, Volatiana has been able to meet her family's daily needs and send her child to school. She has also managed to carry out restoration works on her home. One day she hopes to become a large wholesaler in order to better guarantee the security and future well-being of her household.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and fruit juices

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 68 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Jenny requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. Jenny aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Reinaldo

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 52 años de edad que todas las mañanas se levanta a labran el futuro de su familia, trabajar en su negocio de cría de aves buscando ese sustento que le permita llevar el pan de cada día a su mesa, empezó como emprendedor hace algunos años, aprendió del negocio gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres y decidió usar sus habilidades para trabajar para otras personas hasta darse cuenta que podía ser más lucrativa y beneficioso montar y trabajar su propio negocio.

Manuel quiere mejorar la producción de huevos y de venta de pollos por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 20 gallinas ponedoras y 200 pollos, este préstamo ayudara a potenciar y aumentar las ventas, también comprara alimento para tener existencias y no dejar que sus animales pasen necesidades.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man of 52 years old who gets up every morning to build a future for his family. He works in his poultry farming business, looking to support the household and provide daily sustenance for his family. He began as an entrepreneur some years ago. He learned the business from his father and decided to use his skills to work for others, until he realised that it would be more lucrative and beneficial to set up and work in his own business. 

Manuel wants to improve egg production and chicken sales, so he is requesting a loan to buy 20 laying hens and 200 chickens. This loan will help to boost and increase sales and will also buy feed, so that Manuel can build up a stock and prevent his animals from going hungry.

loans.use: to buy 20 laying hens and 200 chickens

loans.name: Kanuya Group

texts.fr:
Boukary est celui au milieu tenant dans sa main la puisette.
Pour  la  bonne marche de son activité de maraichage, Boukary  à juger nécessaire de faire  recourt au prêt du RMCR  pour acheter plus de semences et d’intrants  en piments, poivres, tomates, aubergines. Il fait la culture des maraichers depuis 06 ans .Il s’approvisionne en semences  et intrants dans les foires de la localité et après avoir fait l’entretien de son jardin il  vend  ses produits  sur le marché local  et cette  vente  lui permet de réaliser un bénéfice qui varie entre 90000 à 150000 f par cycle de prêts .Dans l’exécution de son  travail il  est souvent confronté à certains problèmes tel que la mévente , les insectes).
Boukary est âgée de 48 ans, père de 05 enfants dont 01 scolarisé tous âgées de 17 à 05 ans il  réside au MALI et il n’a pas  eu  une chance d’aller à l’école.
texts.en:
Boukary is the main in the middle holding the bucket. In order for his market gardening activity to run smoothly, Boukary deemed it necessary to request a loan from RMCR to purchase more seeds and farming inputs for chillis, peppercorns, tomatoes and aubergines. He has been working as a market gardener for six years. He gets his supplies of seeds and inputs from the local markets and then he maintains his garden. While carrying out this work, he is often confronted with problems such as slumps in sales and insects eating his crops.

Boukary is 48 years and is a father to five children aged between five and 17 years old. One of them is currently receiving an education. He lives in Mali and never had the opportunity to attend school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farming inputs for their garden

loans.name: Nhóm 9_Khu Phố 3_Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Huế is 38 years old and married with two children. She has a business providing karaoke services and has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Huế is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her karaoke service.  

Huế is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 9_Khu phố 3_Phú Sơn solidarity group. In 2015, Huế joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. In the future, Huế hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain her karaoke service.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from selling charcoal and fattening pigs.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. She has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nissondia Group

texts.en: Djéneba is the woman holding the sheep by the horn in the photo. She is a 35-year-old mother to six children, two of whom are currently receiving an education. Djéneba has been rearing sheep for six years. She is taking out this loan from RMCR in order to purchase rams to rear then sell at the local market where she gets her supplies and livestock. As a livestock farmer, the profits she'll be able to make will allow her to purchase one cow and two sheep. In addition to this, Djéneba will aid her husband purchase school supplies for their children. In the future, she would like to start rearing cows in order to make a more substantial revenue. She has yet to encounter any serious problems with this venture.

loans.use: to purchase sheep, feed them then sell them on

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years now.

Cresilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for boat repair. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat repair

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his shoe business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and increase capital. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale on his stall

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Edith has been working hard to manage her timber business, which sells timber logs. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help Edith to generate greater profits and earn profits. Edith hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a carpentry station.

loans.use: to buy more timber and therefore increase her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for eight years.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, coffee, etc. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a food production business business in the Philippines. Marilou has been in this business for nine years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marilou requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kratie province, Sokha is36 years old and is a mother of four children. Because of her family’s living, she grows cassava and work on others for a fee for more than five years. She could earn around 35,600KHR per day. 

This is her third cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She is leading a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farming. She hopes that she will improve her family’s living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farming

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 27 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. For the past 5 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells sugar molasses . 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar mollases, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and improve the business. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to have a better business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar molasses to sell for greater profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: Gustavo es habitante de un barrio ubicado en la ciudad de Barranquilla en el cual funciona su negocio de venta de bebidas;  su cuñado le cedió la administración del negocio gracias a sus habilidades e implemento cambios que se hicieron notar de inmediato en sus ventas.  Hoy en día lleva 10 años en la administración del local con una variada gama de productos entre ellos cervezas, gaseosas y refrescos que ofrece los fines de semana a partir de las 3 p.m. a 5 a.m., sus principales consumidores son vecinos y referidos que desean compartir un rato de esparcimiento y diversión.  Está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá canastas de cervezas, gaseosa y refrescos, con la finalidad de obtener descuentos por la compra por volúmenes, permitiéndole obtener mayores ganancias.  Gustavo tiene 28 años y es padre de un niño de tres años,  él desea que su negocio sea altamente competitivo para a futuro incrementar sus ventas.  Su meta es comprar su apartamento.
texts.en:
Gustavo lives in a neighbourhood in the city of Barranquilla, where he runs his business selling beverages. His brother-in-law transferred the management of the business to him, thanks to his skills, and he implemented changes which had an immediate effect on sales. He has now been managing the store for ten years. It has a wide range of products, including beers, soda and soft drinks, offered on weekends from 3pm until 5am. His main customers are neighbours and people who have heard about the store, who want to share a few moments of fun and relaxation.

He is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in cases of beer, soda and soft drinks, with the purpose of obtaining discounts buying in bulk, so as to increase his profits. 

Gustavo is 28 years old and is father to a little boy of three. He wants his business to be highly competitive, so as to increase his sales in the future. His goal is to buy his own apartment.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer, soda and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 40 years old and married with seven children, four of whom in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been running the charcoal business for four years and also earns income from goat fattening.

Ellen requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. Ellen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dildebu

texts.ru: Дилдебу, 47 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Дилдебу средне образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи она 29 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Дилдебу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Дилдебу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Dildebu is 47 years old, married and has two children. Dildebu has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she started working with livestock breeding 29 years ago. Thanks to Dildebu's persistent work, her farm currently has eight cows and ten sheep. The monthly income is 14,000 som (KGS).

Dildebu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing her herd.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 27 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is singl. For the past 2 years, Ayub has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells mattresses. 

To help expand his business, Ayub has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mattresses, and will help Ayub to generate greater profits and improve the business. Ayub hopes that in the future he will be able to have a better business.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for his retail business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 29 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his agriculture business, which sells agricultural chemicals for improving crop yields. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agriculture chemicals and will help Paul to generate greater profits and improve business. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to have a good business.

loans.use: to buy more agriculture chemicals for improving crop yields

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 28 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her video library business, which sells DVD's, CD's, movies. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more CD's,DVDs and movies and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and increase standards of living. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more CD's, DVD's for her video library business

loans.name: Aselkan

texts.ru: Аселкан, 61 год, вдова, образование- среднее, дети взрослые. Аселкан начала свой бизнес в 1990 году, с 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы и 10 овец. На участке мерою 0,96 Га она выращивает арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Аселкан в целях развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для выращивания экологически чистых овощей. Доходы от кредита Аселкан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также хочет построить дом.
texts.en:
Aselkan is 61 years old and a widow. Her children are grown ups. She has secondary education. Aselkan started her business in 1990 with 5,000 som (KGS). Currently her farm has two cows and ten sheep. She also grows watermelon for selling and internal use on a plot of land of 0.96 hectares. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aselkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and plastic covering for growing ecological vegetables. Aselkan plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business, and she would also like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and plastic covering to grow ecological vegetables

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim, 32, is a cassava farmer on three hectares farmland living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she is living in her three-children-family and two of her children are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. She has been involved in this business for ten years and it earns her about 45,000KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, pay for labor fees and pay for farmland rented. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yields than last year and ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, pay for labor fees and pay for farmland rented

loans.name: Sie's Group

texts.en:
Sie, 28, is a mother of a small child who lives in Steung Treng province. Nowadays, she does rice farming and raises piglets for sale to support her family’s living for six years. Her family’s income is about 40,000KHR per day. 

She is now leading a group of four to take the first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizers for her farming and pig feeds for raising piglets. In the future, she hopes to have a better house for her family to stay.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for better crop production

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for better produce and sales.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 31 years old, lives in Kandal province ,Cambodia. She is married and has two daughters. They are still young. Her parents are living with her family.

Nowadays, Dina is a weaver and has owned her own business for 11 years. She sells clothing that she weaves at the local market. Her husband works for a private company as a revenue collector . He has only been employed for two months. Previously he was a rice farmer. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle so both her and her husband can travel to work. She wants to increase her family income and enable her children to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family.

loans.name: Urmatkan

texts.ru: Урматкан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. Ее прибыль на сегодня составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). Урматкан  повторно обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для увеличения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Урматкан будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Urmatkan successfully repaid her previous loan, after having used it as intended. She thanks Kiva and all who helped her with the financing. Her income currently is around 22,000 som (KGS).

Urmatkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" again for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase goods for increasing her assortment. She will invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for retail sales, in order to increase assortment in her shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.ru: Роза, 51 год, замужем, мать 7 детей. Образование - средне-специальное, много лет работала продавцом. Сейчас занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав свою деятельность в 1993 году, на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 20 овец. Также на земельном участке, мерою 2,0 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежедневно Роза продает молоко. Она полна сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес и заниматься любимым делом, так как нужно помогать своим детям и внукам. Сегодня ежемесячная прибыль Розы составляет 24,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и бычка для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и свадьбы детей.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has vocational education and worked as a saleswoman for many years. Currently she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started her business in 1993. 

Rosa currently  has six cows and twenty sheep. She also has a plot of land of 2.0 hectares where she grows haricots for selling. Rosa sells milk every day. She develops her business with full strength and energy and loves what she does, as she needs to help her children and grandchildren. Currently her monthly income is 24,000 som (KGS). 

Rosa turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and a bull-calf to fatten and resell. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business and in marrying away her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a bull-calf for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 37 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. На протяжении 15 лет Жылдызкан занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодня есть 2 коровы, на 0,5 Га земли выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В ближайших планах Жылдызкан – увеличить выручку от бизнеса и улучшить условия проживания семьи.
texts.en:
Zhyldyzkan is 37 years old, married and has four children. She has worked with agriculture for a period of 15 years. Thanks to persistent work, she currently has two cows, and she grows potatoes and sweet corn on 0.5 hectares of land. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zhyldyzkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. Zhyldyzkan's short term plan is to increase the income from the business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for increasing of her herd

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
37-year-old Amal, lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka and is the mother of four children. She has been selling wedding dresses and evening dresses for seven years, to help her husband with their household and education expenses.

She will use this loan to buy more dresses to sell and redecorate her shop to attract more customers increase her incomes.

loans.use: to buy more wedding and evening dresses to sell and also to redecorate her shop

loans.name: Sokyen

texts.en: Sokyen is living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province. She is ages 38 years old and a mother of five children and with two of them in school. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and cassava for sale around twenty years and she could earn about 60,800KHR per day. Now she lacks  funds to do farming, so she decided to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to have enough ability to buy more farmland and keep sending her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Sort

texts.en:
Sort is a 63-year-old mother of eight children, living in Battambang province. Nowadays, she grows rice and works on the other farm for fees for forty-three years already. 

Sort has been with VisioinFund for eight cycles and fully repaid back the loan. Due to lack of fund, she is now applying for a new loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yields than previous year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia works hard to support her family. Vevencia is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like woods and lumber for her business.

Vevencia has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Vevencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood and lumber for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 five gallons of palm oil and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn Trung  Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Loan is 23 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 Thôn Trung  Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Loan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Loan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Loan has been involved in this business for 3 years.

The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell for the benefit of her family today and in the future

loans.name: Touer's Group

texts.en:
Touer, 22, lives in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province; she is a married woman who has only one dependent daughter. For a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. She also raises ten chickens in order to supplement the family’s income. Touer has been involved in her jobs for years and she can earn about 25,000KHR per day from it. 

This is the first time for Touer to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is leading a group of two members to get a loan to buy fuel and fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fuel and fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Noren

texts.en:
Noren is 35 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running it for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Noren has borrowed and paid 15 previous loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has requested a new loan, of 10,000 Philippine pesos, through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Noren aspires to saving enough money to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is 44 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and earns additional income from fishing.

Jojie is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She works tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old and married with one child, who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell, such as sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs and canned goods.

In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, such as sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs and canned goods

loans.name: Abraham Jose

texts.es:
Abraham es un hombre de 25 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de cría de cerdos el cual desea comenzar por necesidad económica puesto que tiene dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad y su pareja que depende económicamente de él y al no encontrar un empleo decidió buscar su propio camino en donde buscara consolidar su empresa que sirva para el sustento y crecimiento económico de su amado hogar.

Abrham desea montar una cría de cerdos y el dinero lo destinara en la compra de materiales para la construcción de las cocheras y animales (cerdos) para abastecerlas, parte del capital lo invertirá en compra de cuido de engorde.
texts.en:
Abraham is a 25-year-old man who is asking for a loan to begin a business raising pigs, which he wants to start due to economic necessity since he has two daughters, ages 5 and 3, and his partner who depends on him economically. When he didn't find work, he decided to seek his own path where he looks to strengthen his business which will serve for the support and economic growth of his beloved household.

Abraham wants to establish a pig-raising business and the money will be used to purchase materials for the construction of pens and animals (pigs) to stock them. Part of the capital will be invested in purchasing concentrated pig feed to fatten them.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build pens and animals (pigs).

loans.name: Agustin Sinecio

texts.es:
A sus 72 años de edad el señor Agustín tiene fuerzas de emprenderse, para crear empresa no hay límite de edad, paro por un tiempo sin trabajo debido a una incapacidad pero ahora vuelve con muchas energías y solicitando un apoyo para iniciar un cría de cerdos, con el préstamo comprara materiales para la construcción de cocheras y 5 cerdos.

Ayuda a este empresario que a pesar de su “enfermedad” desear generar su propio sustento y ayudar en su familia.
texts.en:
At 72 years old, Agustín has the strength to undertake a venture; to create a business there is no age limit. He stopped for some time without working due to health, but now he comes back with a lot of energy and is asking for a loan to begin to raise pigs. With the loan, he will purchase materials to build pigpens and 5 pigs.

Help this businessman who, despite his "illness", wants to generate his own income and help his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build pigpens and 5 pigs.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conchita is 55 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Conchita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and works hard to support her family.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negos Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy materials, such as wood, nails and paints.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as wood, nails and paints.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is thankful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she has been able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, instant noodles, soda, biscuits and frozen foods that she sells on a retail basis. She is happy for the way her store's sales and earnings have increased. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely sustain her, her household and the school needs of ther child. 

Perla dreams of having a bigger general store and living a healthy life with her loved ones. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Imelda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Imelda has sustained her business activities through her past 19 loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Imelda is borrowing 16,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business, like fish containers, gasoline and a fishing net.

She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like fish containers, gasoline and a fishing net

loans.name: Nolhanena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nolhanena works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nolhanena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Nolhanena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 44 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Criselda works very hard to provide for them.

Criselda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Criselda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Criselda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Arnodis Lucia

texts.es: Arnodis es una mujer de 29 años que guiada por un deseo de iniciar su propio negocio llego a Interactuar con la esperanza de que le apoyaran un préstamo que necesitaba para iniciar con la venta de calzado y sandalias (calzado más usado en la región), en Interactuar le ofrecieron la oportunidad de pertenecer a KIVA y es con mucho agrado e ilusión que pide ayuda a toda la comunidad para que apoyen su idea de negocio la cual quiere implementar por necesidad económica , busca generar recursos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y permitirse soñar con un futuro en donde su hijo tenga la posibilidad de asistir a una universidad lo cual para ella sería un sueño hecho realidad.
texts.en: Arnodis is a 29-year-old woman who, guided by her desire to open her own business, came to Interactuar with the hope that it would support her with a loan that she needs to begin selling footwear and sandals (the footwear most used in the region). At Interactuar, they offered her the opportunity that belongs to Kiva and it is with great desire and excitement that she asks for help from the whole community so that they can support her business idea which she wants to implement due to economic necessity. She seeks to generate the resources to improve her family's quality of life and allow herself to dream of a future where her child has the possibility of going to university, which for her would be a dream come true.

loans.use: to begin selling footwear and sandals (the footwear most used in the region).

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson, se dedica a desarrollar las actividades de agricultura y ganadería como una forma de ir generando ingresos para cumplir con sus responsabilidades; vive en casa propios junto a su esposa e hijos, por el momento no representa dificultades para seguir trabajando.
Invertirá en abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada de maíz y frijol para ampliar el área de cultivo y para preparar el terreno en que siembra, espera tener una cosecha abundante que le permita alimentar a su familia y con otra parte abastecer a sus clientes, de esa manera podrá generar ingresos para cubrir otros gastos familiares.
Su objetivo es mantener con actividad su negocio para tener una mejor economía familiar.
texts.en:
Nelson works doing agricultural and animal husbandry tasks as a way to generate income to meet his responsibilities. He lives with his wife and children in a house he owns. At the moment, there are no difficulties with continuing to work.

He will invest in manure, herbicide, and improved corn and bean seeds to expand the area under cultivation and to prepare the land that he plants. He hopes to have an abundant harvest which will permit him to feed his family and, with the other part, supply his customers. In this way, he will be able to generate income to cover other family expenses.

His goal is to keep his business active to have a better family economy.

loans.use: to invest in manure, herbicide, and improved corn and bean seeds to expand the area under cultivation and to prepare the land where he plants.

loans.name: Samrob

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Samrob is 21 years old. She is a married woman who has one dependent daughter. 

The main source of her family’s income is from growing paddy rice and cassava. She sometimes works as a paid worker to supplement her income. She has been in her business for ages. 

This is the first time for her to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan to buy fuel to power a walking tractor for farming purposes. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living standard and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fuel to power a walking tractor for farming purposes

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Delfino Osbeli

texts.es:
Delfino es un hombre de 26 años, es casado vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Delfino con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja como carnicero desde hace cinco años, gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a su querida familia.
Delfino ahora se ve a la necesidad de remodelar la cocina pues hasta estos días no cuenta con una buena presentación por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar piso, cemento  y así dejar su cocina presentable.
Delfino sueña con poder terminar la construcción de su casa y también ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfino is a 26-year-old man. He is married and lives with his wife in a community of Suchitepéquez.

Delfino, with the desire to earn income and get his family ahead, has worked as a butcher for the past five years. Thanks to this work, he has gotten his beloved family ahead. 

Delfino now sees the need to remodel the kitchen since, up to now, it hasn't had a good appearance, so he asks for a loan to purchase flooring, cement and make his kitchen presentable.

Delfino dreams of being able to finish the construction of his house and also of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase flooring and cement.

loans.name: Gladis Liliana

texts.es: Gladis es una joven de 26 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad ambos hombres, se desempeño estos últimos 7 años como madre de familia, su esposo generaba el sustento necesario para su mantenimiento pero ahora que sus hijos ya están más grandes quiere buscar su propio camino e iniciar un negocio de lo que mejor sabe hacer que es la confección, el problema es que no cuenta con el capital, solo tiene el conocimiento y clientes para iniciar su proyecto que tiene como objetivo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, mejorar la alimentación, interior del hogar, independencia económica de su esposo y lo más importante comprar un hogar propio y darle educación a sus hijos, muchos sueños y proyectos que se ha auto impuesto y que tiene el tiempo y el entusiasmo para lograrlo, por ello solicita un apoyo económico para iniciar su profesión, dicho capital lo destinara en la compra de 3 maquinas planas y una maquina fileteadora, generando un empleo de primera, arrancara con toda esperando a tener éxito y mantener su empresa en el tiempo.
texts.en: Gladis is a 26-year-old young woman, the mother of two children, ages 4 and 7, both boys. She has worked for the past 7 years as a mother, her husband generated the income necessary for their support, but now that her children are older, she wants to look for her own path and begin a business doing what she knows best, which is sewing. The problem is that she doesn't have the capital, she only has the knowledge and customers to begin her project which has as its goal improving the condition of the house, improving their nutrition, the interior of the home, economic independence from her husband, and, the most important, to purchase their own home and provide an education for their children. She has many dreams and projects that she has established for herself and which she has the time and enthusiasm to achieve. For this, she asks for a loan to begin her profession. This capital will be used to purchase 3 flat machines and a serger, generating a job first. She will start with the hope of having success and maintaining her business over time.

loans.use: to begin a sewing business, she will purchase 3 flat machines and a serger.

loans.name: Norain

texts.en:
Norain is 44 years old and married. With three children who are in school, Norain works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like chips, spices, canned goods, noodles, coffee, etc.

Norain has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Norain would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like chips, spices, canned goods, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dionesia is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Dionesia has a general store business in the Philippines. Dionesia requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Dionesia has been in this business for eight years. Dionesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
Dina es una joven de 20 años de edad que desde muy joven decidió hacer su vida con su pareja, tiene un hijo y un humilde pero cálido hogar en donde hasta el día de hoy no les ha faltado nada gracias a la gestión de su pareja, ella también aporta su granito de arena en su familia no solo cuidando al pequeño y haciendo las labores del hogar, tiene montado en su casa una venta de mercancía, ubica todos su productos en una vitrina y la visión es tener un negocio bien montado y auto sostenible.

Dina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de chancletas, barnice, accesorios, peinillas, labiales, productos de revista como ropa y lociones y surtido de galletería.

Este préstamo le permitirá abastecer su negocio con suficiente surtido como para captar mucho más la atención de su público, su estrategia es vender productos que estén al alcance de sus vecinos, que al igual que ella son personas de bajos recursos que luchan por ser grandes.
texts.en:
Dina is a 20-year-old young woman who, since she was very young, decided to make her life with her partner. She has a child and a humble but warm home, where to date they haven't lacked anything thanks to her partner's earnings. She also contributes her grain of sand to the family not only caring for the little one and doing the household chores, but she has established a sale of merchandise in her home. She puts all her products in a display case and the vision is to have a well-established business that is self-sustaining. 

Dina wants to ask for a loan to purchase flip-flops, nail polish, accessories, combs, lipstick, products from magazines such as clothing and lotions, and stock for the cookie store.

This loan will allow her to stock her store with a sufficient assortment to attract her public's attention much more. Her strategy is to sell products that are within the reach of her neighbors who, like her, are people of limited resources who struggle to be more.

loans.use: to purchase flip-flops, nail polish, accessories, combs, lipstick, products from magazines such as clothing and lotions, and stock for the cookie store.

loans.name: Nordita

texts.en:
Nordita is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, milk, coffee, bread, canned goods, etc.

Nordita has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, milk, coffee, bread, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer de 39 años de edad que se dedica a la confección a terceros, no tiene hijos ni pareja solo su negocio que está en vía de crecimiento y que ahora busca un apoyo económica para darle el empujón que necesita para despegar, el apoyo es un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de una maquina fileteadora.

Para su empresa esta maquinaria será un gran aporte a su día a día ya que gracias a esta podrá generar un empleo, optimizar sus tiempos de producción, aceptar mayor mercancía y considerarse una fuerte competidora en la zona capaz de entregar grandes encargos a tiempo record.

Su sueño es tener un grupo de trabajo con 15 operarios las cuales pueda controlar y hagan de su empresa una de las confecciones más solicitadas y apetecidas pos los comerciantes de Medellín.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 39-year-old woman who works sewing for third parties. She doesn't have children or a partner, just her business which is growing and now she looks for economic support to give it the boost that it needs to take off. The support is a loan that she will invest in the purchase of a serger.

For her business, this machine will be a great support in her day-to-day work since, thanks to this, she will be able to generate a job, optimize her production time, accept more merchandise and consider herself a strong competitor in the zone, capable to completing big orders in record time. 

Her dream is to have a work group with 15 operators which she can runl and make her business one of the most requested and desired sewing shops for the business people in Medellín.

loans.use: to purchase a serger to speed her production time.

loans.name: Tors

texts.en:
Being a farmer in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Tors is a 40-year-old, married mother of four dependent children. Two of them are in school and the other two are too young to attend school. 

In order to support the family’s living, she works as a construction worker. Besides that, she also grows rice to supplement the income. She has been involved in her business for 22 years; she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

For Tors, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking a loan to buy wood and cement to build her house and pay for the workers. She hopes that she can afford to build a new, proper house to live in and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wood and cement to build her house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Josselyn Lisbeth

texts.es:
Josselyn, tiene la necesidad de un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar aceite, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, sal, galletas, etc., tendrá mayor cantidad de productos para la tienda, su esperanza es que las ventas se mantengan estables y atraer nuevos clientes.
Al invertir el financiamiento anterior en el mejoramiento del inventario de la tienda sus utilidades han mejorado, su familia cuenta con mejores condiciones de vida y ha podido mantener la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Josselyn needs another loan to buy oil, beans, sugar, rice, salt, cookies, etc. in order to have a greater quantity of products in her shop.  Her hope is to keep the sales stable and to attract new customers.

After investing the previous financing in the improvement of her shop, her profits improved, her family has better living conditions, and she has been able to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, sugar, rice, salt, cookies, etc. in order to have a greater quantity of products in her shop.

loans.name: Rudy Antonio

texts.es:
Rudy, es un  agricultura que se dedica a cultivar jícama, maíz y frijol, el oficio le fue enseñado por su familia, cuenta con gran experiencia en el área y está trabajando de forma independiente desde hace ya 20 años. Rudy es casado, vive con su esposa  y sus hijos, todos son dependientes y él lucha cada día para conservar su fuente de ingresos con vida y así salir adelante con su familia.
El crédito que solicita a Padecomsm lo destinara a la compra de abono, herbicidas e insecticidas para llevar a cabo la próxima siembra de sus cultivos, espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio, así como también atender a nuevos clientes para tener nuevos ingresos, no representa riesgos en la inversión.
Los sueños que don Rudy tiene son mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y darles a sus hijos apoyo incondicional para que culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rudy is a farmer who works growing jícama, corn, and beans. He was shown this work by his family, and he has a lot of experience in the area and has been working independently for the past 20 years. Rudy is married, and lives with his wife and their children. They are all dependents and he struggles each day to keep his source of income alive and, in this way, get ahead with his family. 

The loan that he requests from Padecomsm will be used to purchase manure, herbicide and insecticide to carry out the next planting of his crops. He hopes to increase his business's production, and also to serve new customers to have new income. There aren't any risks in the investment.

Rudy's dreams are to improve the infrastructure of his house and give his children unconditional support so that they end up with a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicide and insecticide to carry out the next planting of his crops.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab is a local farmer who lives in Bakan district of Pursat province. She is 41 years old and she is a mother of six children, five of whom are dependent on her. Now, there are four children in school. 

To support her living, she grows rice as the main source of income. She also works as a teacher to supplement her income. Mab has been involved in her jobs for 23 years. 

This is the fourth time for Mab to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully paid her past loan. For this time, Mab is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат, 36 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи Гульзат занимается сельским хозяйством. Начатый со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)- приобрели 3 овцы, бизнес на сегодня приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 1,50 Га земли она выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса за счет покупки удобрений для полеводства.
texts.en: Gulzat is 36 years old, married, and raising four children. She has a secondary education. Gulzat farms as a source of income for her family. Starting with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS) she acquired three sheep. Today the business yields about 9,000 som (KGS) per month. She has two cows, and she grows potatoes on 1.5 hectares of land. In order to further develop her business, Gulzat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep. Gulzat plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business by buying fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Catarina Dalila

texts.es:
Catarina es una muchacha de 20 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija de tres años, vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Catarina con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su hija se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace un año.
Catarina desde hace algunos días había tenido el anhelo de remodelar su cocina pero esto no ha sido posible  porque no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar cal, arena, piso para el repello de la pared y cambio de pisos, por tal razón ahora acude a un préstamo para poder realizar su remodelación.
Catarina sueña con poder ver a su hija convertida en toda una profesional y dejarle una buena herencia.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 20-year-old girl. She is single and has a 3-year-old daughter. She lives in a community of Nahuala.

Catarina, with the desire to earn an income and get her daughter ahead, works buying and selling vegetables. She has had this business for one year.

Catarina recently has had the desire to remodel her kitchen but this has not been possible because she doesn't have enough money to purchase lime, sand, and flooring to whitewash the walls and replace the flooring. For this reason, she now comes to get a loan to be able to do her remodeling.

Catarina dreams of being able to see her daughter become a professional and leave her a good inheritance.

loans.use: to purchase lime, sand, and flooring to whitewash the walls and replace the flooring.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is grateful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for a new 17,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer, farm seedlings, pots, wires and net she needs for growing green and healthy ornamental plants, which she sells to individuals and uses in her landscaping service. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Aurelia dreams to grow and be more successful in her ornamental farm and do more landscaping services. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies, such as seedlings and fertilizer, needed in her business

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 44 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Norlita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 53 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 22 years.

Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Barchinoi

texts.ru: Барчиной, 1972 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей, образование высшее. В ведении хозяйства и бизнеса помогают муж и дети. За время оформления документов Барчиной показала себя с положительной стороны, как человек трудолюбивый, спокойный и ответственный. Свой бизнес Барчиной начинала 18 лет назад. В настоящее время Барчиной в своем активе имеет 2 коровы. Имеются все условия для содержания скота. Свою деятельность осуществляет на основании своего многолетнего опыта, знает все тонкости в сфере животноводства. Барчиной обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец для откорма и продажи. Барчиной подсчитала, что реализация овец поможет ей организовать свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Barchinoi was born in 1972. She is married and has two children. She has higher education. Her husband and children help her manage her business. During the administrative paperwork to get a loan, Barchinoi showed herself as a hardworking, calm and responsible person. 

Barchinoi started her business 18 years ago. Currently she has two cows. She has all conditions for breeding livestock available. She manages her business on the basis of many years of experience, and she knows all particularities of livestock breeding.

Barchinoi turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase eight sheep for fattening and reselling. She is counting on that selling the sheep will help her organize her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep for fattening and reselling, in order to save money for her son's wedding

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha is a farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province. At the age of 54, Tha is a married mother of five children. Two of them are dependent on her. 

She grows rice and raises pigs as the main sources of income. Besides this, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her jobs for 36 years. 

This is Tha’s third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is now leading a group of six to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy land and wood to renovate her house. She hopes that she can live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy land and wood to renovate her house

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 38 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer and pay electric and internet bills for her internet cafe business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer and pay electric and internet bills

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, canned goods, fish, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, canned goods, fish, etc.

loans.name: Percie

texts.en:
Percie is 42 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school, Percie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Percie has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Percie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Precy has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Precy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erna is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Erna has a business farming root crops and vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erna has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 46 years old and married with five children.

Evelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelina has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and fish vending.

Evelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: My's Group

texts.en:
A local resident who lives in Bakan district of Pursat province, My is 28 years old. My is also a married mother of four children, one of whom is in school. To support her family’s living, she is growing paddy rice as the main source of income. Having been in this job for 28 years, My can earn about 28,800 KHR per day. 

This is My’s fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully paid her past loan. As a leader of a group of three, My will use her loan portion that she is applying for to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle and to save with VisionFund.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Astra

texts.ru: Астра, 36 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Астры - среднее образование. С 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая картофель на 0,35 ГА арендованной земли. Также есть корова и 30 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Астры, ее ежемесячный доход составляет 6,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Астра является лидером группы "Астра", всего в группе - 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Астра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить на строительство дома.
texts.en:
Astra is 36 years old, married and has four children. Astra has secondary education. Since 1994 she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, growing potatoes on 0.35 hectares of rented land. She also has a cow and 30 sheep. Thanks to Astra's persistent work, her monthly income is 6,600 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves. Astra is the leader of the group "Astra". They are three people in the group. Astra plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, in order to save money for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase calves to increase of her herd and save money for building a house

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer who lives in Bakan district of Pursat province, Ny is a 53-year-old married mother of four dependent children who are still in school. 

For a living, Ny has been growing rice on 5 hectares of farmland as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she raises pigs as well. She has been involved in her business for 35 years. 

This time is the second time for Ny to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully paid her past loan. Ny, the group leader of three members, will spend her loan to buy a motorcycle to support her business. She hopes that she will be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support her business

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, 32, is a farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province. She is a mother of four dependent children, three of whom are in school. The other is too young to attend school. 

She has been growing rice on a three-hectare farmland as the main source of income. Sokha has been involved in this business for 12 years and she is able to earn about 27,100 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth time for her to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. Now, Sokha is leading a group of three to get a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees. 

She hopes that she is able to improve her living condition much better and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide, and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
A $600.00 is offered to Fernanda to improve her business. she has a business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy traditional clothes.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Fernanda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothes

loans.name: Saveun's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province, Saveun is 62 years old. This widow has five children. To support her living, she sells grocery items as the main source of income. She has been in her business for 44 years.

This is the third loan for Saveun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has fully repaid her past loans. Leading a new group to get a loan, Saveun will use her loan to build a new latrine. She hopes that she can provide her family with hygienic living.

loans.use: to build a new latrine.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis is 32 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Flordelis has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Flordelis has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Rovelie

texts.en:
Rovelie works hard to support five children. She is married and has a farming rice business in the Philippines.

Rovelie requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Rovelie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 29 years old, married, and has four children. With three children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary pads, noodles, cereals, etc.  

Helen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary pads, noodles, cereals, etc. to sell.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary pads, noodles, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old, and two of her children are in school.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of fish to sell.

Precy has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 56 years old, married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 39 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
A local resident living in Muk Kampul district of Kandal province, Him is a married father of four children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. For a living, Him harvests crop products for others for a fee, which is a main source of income. Besides, in order to supplement his family’s income, Him raises pigs and fish. He has been involved in his jobs for 11 years.

This is Him’s second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as he has fully repaid his past loan. He will use his entire loan to pay for his children’s school fee and to buy decent clothes for family members. He hopes that he can afford his children’s studies until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s school fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 150 bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in a village with her family. She is a widow and has a child. Her standard of living is normal. 

Gulnora is a teacher at a secondary school. She taught Russian and now she teaches computer science to students. For about four years, she has worked at a secondary school. 

She got a loan some years ago to repair her house. She finished repairing, but is still left without walls in her house. She wants to build walls for her house in order to live safely. 

Gulnora is asking for a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to build walls for her house. She will use the service of builders and construct the walls for her house. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build walls for her house

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda has a market stall in which she sells fruits and vegetables. She has requested a loan from PMPC to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retailing to increase her inventory. 

This way, Nilda will be able to sell more products, enabling her to earn more money and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to increase her inventory

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Jessica has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy, 25, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ivy has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Ivy requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

In the future, Ivy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Watti

texts.en:
Watti works hard to support her family. Watti is married and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Watti has been in this business for 17 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Watti would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rang's Group

texts.en:
Rang is a farmer living in the Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. She is 36 years old and she is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school. 

For supporting their living conditions, Rang grows cassava as the main source of income. She also works as paid worker to supplement the family’s income. 

This is the first time for Rang to be with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is leading a group of five to get a loan. She will spend her loan to purchase more seeds for her cassava farming. She hopes to improve her living conditions much better than before.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds for her cassava farming

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru: Юлдузхон, 49 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Семья очень большая, трудолюбивая и дружная. У Юлдузхон- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS).
