Благодаря упорному труду Юлдузхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова. На 0,27 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Юлдузхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистых картофеля и помидоров. Доходы от кредита Юлдузхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса- Юлдузхон хочет построить теплицу.
texts.en: Yulduzkhon is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her family is very large, hard-working and tight-knit. Yulduzkhon has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops as main source of income for her family, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Yulduzkhon's hard work, today she has a cow. She grows potatoes on 0.27 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Yulduzkhon has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds and fertilizer to treat her land and grow organic potatoes and tomatoes. Yulduzkhon plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business - Yulduzkhon wants to build a greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow organic tomatoes and potatoes, in order to be more profitable and build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Sarong

texts.en:
Sarong, a farmer, is living in Dong Tung district of Kampot province. She is 58 years old and a married mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

For a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. Moreover, in order to supplement income, she raises pigs. She has been involved in her jobs for 40 years. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sarong is applying for a loan to pay for university fees and buy more school supplies for her children. She hopes that her children can get good jobs after they graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and buy more school supplies for her children

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries, such as bottled water, candies, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, milk, cereals, etc., to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as bottled water, candies, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, milk, cereals, etc.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, such as bottled water, candies, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, milk, cereals, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
SEYDOU N’TJI est celui qui tient le mouton en mains sur la photo. C’est un cultivateur Malien, non scolarisé, âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 10 enfants, âgées de 09 mois à 29 ans dont cinq  fréquentent l’école. Il fait l’activité d’élevage de moutons et caprins depuis 20 ans et sa femme est une ménagère.
SEYDOU N’TJI s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant et revend ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il en tire lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
Il emprunte de l’argent au RMCR pour  acheter plus de moutons et caprins. 
SEYDOU N’TJI  rencontre souvent le problème de baisse de cours des animaux sur le marché lors des ventes. Son rêve est d’avoir un prêt plus élevé  dans l’avenir afin de devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Seydou N'Tji is the one who is holding the sheep in the photo. He is a 42-year-old Malian farmer, who has not gone to school. He is married and a father of ten children, aged from nine months to 29 years old. Five of the children go to school. His wife is a housewife. 

Seydou N'Tji has worked raising sheep and goats for 20 years. He procures his livestock in the surrounding markets and resells his animals in the same markets. Earnings allow him to meet his family's needs.

He is borrowing money from RMCR to buy more sheep and goats. 

Seydou N'Tji often has the problem of price drops on animals at the market when he is making his sales.

His dream is to have a higher loan in the future so that he can become a large livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to resell after

loans.name: Marie Juliette

texts.fr:
Marie Juliette est une femme très courageuse de 48 ans. Elle est veuve il y a environ 12 ans. Elle a deux enfants et le dernier qui a 15 est en classe de 5ème dans une collège publique actuellement. L'ainé est déjà marié.
Marie Juliette dirige un stand de commerce de différents articles depuis 2003. Depuis le décès de son mari, elle doit continuer seule la lutte et en dépit de tout ça, elle ne se plaint pas et ne baisse jamais les bras. Avec les profits de son activité, elle a pu acheter  l'année dernière un bout de terrain et y construire une petite maison en bois. 
Son objectif est d'abord de développer et étendre son commerce, elle envisage d'ouvrir trois points de vente en province et employer trois personnes pour les diriger. Ensuite, elle projette de construire une maison en dure l'année prochaine. Enfin, il ne faut pas oublier ainsi que l'éducation de son enfant aussi est parmi sa priorité.
texts.en:
Marie Juliette is a very hard-working woman of 48. She has been widowed for about 12 years. She has two children; the younger is 15 and is presently in 7th grade in a public secondary school. The older child is already married. 

Marie Juliette has been running a stall selling various items since 2003. Since the death of her husband, she has had to struggle alone, but in spite of that she does not complain and never gives up. Last year, with the profit from her business, she was able to buy a little plot of land and build a wooden house on it. 
 
Her primary goal is to develop and expand her business. She dreams of opening three sales points outside of the capital and employing three people to run them. Then she plans to build a concrete house next year. And of course, the education of her child is always among her priorities.

loans.use: to buy flashlights, cables, radios, batteries, padlocks, electrical outlets/plugs, light bulbs, etc

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Her name is Jacqueline, 33, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnold, a customer representative, and they are blessed with three children. One is in in high school and the other two are in the elementary level. The couple work hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send their children to school. 

Jacqueline has a small school/office supplies store. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells mineral water by the gallon for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan that she will use to buy more school supplies such as pad paper, pencils, bond, art, cartolina paper, staple wire, folders, envelopes, etc. to sell at retail prices and meet the regular needs of the students, especially now that school year has started in the Philippines. 

She is positive that the loan will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance, for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and the school needs of her children.

Jacqueline hopes to expand her business so her family can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for school/office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is currently in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Imelda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julieta is 61 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Julieta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Julieta has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lady Mae

texts.en:
Lady Mae is 36 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Lady Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Lady Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Lady Mae has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, bread, noodles, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Lady Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se encuentra soltera, vive con una hija, no tiene familiares en el extranjero, ella tiene como fuente de ingresos una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, cuenta con una experiencia de cinco años en el negocio, ya tiene popularidad en su comunidad como una persona responsable y honesta.
Necesita de un crédito que piensa utilizar para comprar aceite, arroz, frijoles, jugos, boquitas, papel higiénico, detergentes, etc., fortalecerá el inventario de su negocio, espera reducir las necesidades de sus clientes y aumentar las ventas para mejorar los ingresos familiares.
Su visión es ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y reducir las carencias de su hogar.
texts.en: Maria is single and lives with a daughter. She doesn't have relatives abroad. The only source of income she has is a general store. She has five years of experience in the business, and is already popular in her community as a responsible and honest person. She needs a loan that she intends to use to purchase purchase oil, rice, beans, juice, snacks, toilet paper, detergent, etc. to improve her business' inventory. She hopes to meet her customers' needs and increase her sales to improve her family income. Her vision is to offer good service to her customers and reduce the deficiencies in her home.

loans.use: purchase oil, rice, beans, juice, snacks, toilet paper, detergent, etc. to improve her business' inventory.

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
Nen is a farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 60-year-old mother of eight children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For a living, Nen is growing rice as her main source of income.  She has been in this business for 42 years. 

This is Nen’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living conditions and make them much better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Wilson Dairon

texts.es:
El señor Wilson es un hombre de 32 años de edad, un cultivador del producto estrella colombiano que es el café, es soltero y todas sus ganancias las destina al crecimiento de su zona para llevar en cada temporada unos kilos de más de café, su meta es llegar a ser proveedor de Juan Valdez la marca de café mas reconocida en Colombia.

En el momento el cultivo del señor Wilson se encuentra en cosecha y necesita insumos para el mantenimiento de estos y garantía de calidad, como ha pasado un tiempo y ha estado invirtiendo sus ganancias en ampliar su cultivo quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insecticidas, fungicidas, herbicidas y la respectiva mano de obra para aplicar estos insumos a su cultivos.

Este préstamo le permitirá tener en un mes un abundante surtido de café de calidad y listo para venderse en la plaza de mercado.
texts.en:
Señor Wilson is a 32-year-old man.  He is a farmer of the star Colombian product, which is coffee.  He is single, and all of his earnings go toward the growth of his land in order to get a few kilos more of coffee each season.  His goal is to become a supplier for Juan Valdez, the most famous brand of coffee in Colombia.

At this moment, Señor Wilson's crops are in harvest and he needs supplies for their maintenance and quality assurance because it has been a while and he has been investing his earnings in expanding his crop.  He wants to request a loan in order to buy insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, and the respective labor to apply these supplies to his crops.

This loan will permit him to have an abundant stock of coffee in a month and to be ready to sell it in the market square.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fungicide, herbicide, and the relative labor to apply these supplies to his crops.

loans.name: Nyeta Group

texts.fr:
ALOU est le Monsieur  qui tient le mouton sur la photo, est un cultivateur Malien, instruit,  âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants  de 1 à 3 ans  non scolarisés. Il fait l’activité d’élevage ovin et le commerce des habits depuis plus de 5 ans et sa femme est une ménagère.
Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant et revend ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il en tire lui permet de satisfaire les  besoins de sa famille.
Il emprunte de l’argent au RMCR pour  acheter plus d’animaux et habits à vendre. 
ALOU  rencontre souvent le problème de mévente des animaux sur le marché lors des ventes. Son rêve est de devenir un exportateur des moutons  dans l’avenir et avoir un prêt élevé.
texts.en:
Alou is the gentleman holding the sheep in the photo. He is a farmer from Mali, educated, aged 45, married and the father of two children aged 1 and 3 years old, not yet enrolled in school. He does livestock raising and has been selling clothing for more than five years. His wife is a housewife. 

He buys his inventory in surrounding markets and resells his animals in the same markets. The profit he makes allows him to satisfy the needs of his family. He is borrowing money from RMCR to buy more animals and also, clothing for resale.  

Alou often encounters the problem of a slump in sales of livestock at the market when he resells his animals. His dream is to become an exporter of sheep in future and be able to borrow a higher amount.

loans.use: to buy livestock and clothing for resale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DRAMANE est le Monsieur  qui tient la corde du bœuf sur la photo ; c’est un cultivateur Malien, âgé de 49 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants âgés de 6 à  20 ans dont deux scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère et fait le petit commerce.
Il est non scolarisé, et exerce l’activité d’embouche et élevage de bovins et ovins il y a 3 ans de cela. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de sa localité et liquide ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il gagne lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille.
DRAMANE fait recourt à L’IMF pour acheter  beaucoup d’animaux pour vendre après
Ayant appris ce métier, il se sent à l’aise de l’exercer car il se voit de participer au développement économique de sa communauté en plus de l’amour qu’il le porte.
DRAMANE est souvent confronté au problème de vente car parfois il donne ses animaux à crédit à l’exportateur  et souhaite devenir  lui-même un grand exportateur dans les jours à venir.
texts.en:
Dramane is the one who is holding the cow's leash in the photo. He is a 49-year-old Malian farmer, who did not go to school. He is married and a father of six children, aged from six to 20 years old. Two of the children go to school. His wife is a housewife and also does small-scale commerce. 

Dramane has worked raising and fattening cows and sheep for three years. He procures his livestock in the local markets and resells the animals in the same markets. 

Earnings allow him to cover his family's expenses. 

Dramane joined this micro-finance institution to buy animals to resell. 

After having learned this work, he feels at ease now because he sees how it contributes to the economic development of his community and he really enjoys it. 

Dramane often confronts problems during resale, because he sells his animals for credit to exporters. 

He wishes to become himself a large exporter in the coming days.

loans.use: to buy animals to resell after

loans.name: Hoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurng is a local farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province. She is 52 years old and a married mother of two children. One of her children is dependent on her and still in school. 

For a living, she grows rice on one and a half hectares of farmland, which is the main source of income. Her business enables her to earn about 25,200 KHR per day. 

This is Hoeurng's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) and she is seeking a new loan to buy wood to renovate her house much better. She hopes that she is able to provide her family members with a decent house.

loans.use: to buy wood to renovate her house.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 41 años de edad, ella ha sido ama de casa gran parte de su vida, pero en el camino ha entablado buenas amistades y ha hecho un sinfín de amigos, esas amistades y esa capacidad de relacionarse las quiere poner a favor en una idea de negocio que desea iniciar el cual será la venta de ropa para hombre y mujer, pues una entrada de dinero extra en su hogar caería muy bien y ayudaría a que tanto su esposo como su hijo tengan una mejor calidad de vida.

Beatriz trabaja por tener su propia entrada de dinero, por ser quien construya una ilusión y un deseo de permitir que su hijo asista a una institución universitaria y pueda inscribirse a un equipo de futbol, trabaja por construir un mejro futuro junto a su familia, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para hombre y dama, ropa juvenil la cual iniciara a vender a sus contactos esperando como es la aceptación de ellos para pensar en vender en zonas como otros barrios o incluso pueblos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 41 years old.   She has been a homemaker for the greater part of her life.  She has established many good friendships in her neighbourhood, and she has made countless friends. These friendships and her ability to relate well to people have given her the idea to start a business of selling clothing.  The input of extra money into the home would be good and it would help both her husband and her son to have a better quality of life.

Beatriz is working to have her own influx of money for which she has built the dream and wish that it will allow her son to attend a university and also to join a soccer team.  She is working to build a better future together with her family.  It is for this that she is requesting a loan to buy clothing for men, women and children which she will start to sell to her contacts, hoping that with its success she will then be able to think about selling in areas such as other neighbourhoods or even towns.

loans.use: to start her own business selling men's, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda is a widow. She is known in their neighborhood area for being a hardworking mother. Lutgarda is receiving a small amount of money each month as a pension from her late husband. 

She became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house. 

She hopes to live happy and healthy with her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Lorielyn

texts.en:
Lorielyn works hard to support her family. Lorielyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lorielyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Lorielyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

Lorielyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en: Hun, 59 years old, is a local farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. This widow woman has one son depending on her; he is still in school. She is growing rice as their main source of income. She has been involved in this business for 41 years. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group of two, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her rice crop. She hopes that she can earn more income to make her standard of living much better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her rice crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida finds pleasure in doing her farm activities and earning as well for her family. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to buy pesticides.

In the future, Leonida wishes to become the supplier of mangoes in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Leang is age 57 and married with six children. To make a living, she has been selling pork meats and raising chickens for additional income. She can earn about 57,800 riels per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Leang is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Leang will use her portion to buy more chickens and chicken feeds. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feeds

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Navy is aged 29 years and married. She has two children, both of whom are too young for school. To support her family, she and her husband have been selling noodle soup and coffee at the market nearby her house. The current business earns her family about 70,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is Navy’s first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Navy wants to use her portion to buy ingredients for making soup and coffee. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making soup and coffee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una señora de 36 años de edad, es casada tiene una hermosa familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 6 y 15 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Julia para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la crianza de pollos, ella tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor, pero para mejores ingresos se dedica a la costura de blusas para damas.
Julia su prioridad es la alimentación de sus pollos pues es de lo que ella generar sus ingresos por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar concentrado por quintal y alimentar de la mejor manera posible a sus pollos para que crezcan y engorden mucho más rápido.
Julia anhela poder construir una mejor casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is a 36 year old woman who is married and has a beautiful family with four children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. This modest family lives in a community of Suchitepéquez.

Julia works raising chickens in order to make her income and get the family ahead. She has been doing this for 4 years and to make more money she works sewing women's blouses.

Julia's priority is food for her chickens as this is how she generates her income. For this reason She is requesting a loan to be able to buy concentrated feed by the quintal and feed her chickens in the best possible way so that they grow and fatten much more rapidly. Julia dreams of constructing a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 45 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 8 y 26 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Blanca su actividad económica es elaborar pasteles y con esta actividad ha sacado adelante a su familia, el tiempo que ella tiene de ejercer esta labor es de ocho años, pero para obtener otros ingresos se dedica a la venta de comida.
Blanca es una de las mejores pasteleras que su comunidad tiene, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales como harina, huevos, royal, margarina y seguir satisfaciendo los antojos de sus clientes.
El gran sueño de Blanca es seguir construyendo su casa para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad  de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 45 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of six children aged between 8 and 26. They live in a community in San Pablo Jocopilas.
Her economic activity is making cakes and with this she has progressed in life with her family. She has been doing this for 8 years but to earn other income she sells food.
She is one of the best cake makers in her community and so she has many clients. This is why she is asking for a loan to be able to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, baking powder, margarine and continue to satisfy the wants of her customers.
Her big dream is to continue building her home so that her children have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, baking powder, margarine to make cakes.

loans.name: Lovyne

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lovyne works hard to support her family. She has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Lovyne has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). Lovyne is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, five who are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lucia has a food production and vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Lucia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yoeur's Group

texts.en:
Yoeur, a local resident living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, is 48 years old, and she is a mother of six children, three of whom are depending on her. One of her children is still in school.

To support her family’s living, she grows rice on a two-hectare plot of farmland as the main source of income. She also tailors clothes for a fee in order to supplement her income. She has been involved in her job for 30 years.

This is the first time she is with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get a loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and fuel for her farm business. She hopes that she can expand her business to be bigger to get more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and fuel for her farm business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a drill, a soldering iron and a polisher to do his work with better quality and satisfy more clients.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Norma is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more different types of shoes and slippers for her business

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Thida is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are dependent on her and still in school. Sesame and tobacco growing has been the main source of her family’s income for 17 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid motor-taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Thida’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Thida, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing tobacco and sesame. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing tobacco and sesame

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia, con sus tres menores hijos de edades 16, 10, 2 años de de edad de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria el segundo primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucara. Ella vive en la parte rural de este distrito, esta comunidad queda en la provincia de Jaen, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Tomasa es la venta de salchipollos, salchipapas su local esta ubicado frente a la comisaria de Pucará, ella cuenta con más de 2 años dedicándose a este rubro con muy buenas referencias, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves domésticas como gallinas, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin mayor problema; el destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos como bebidas gaseosas,entre otros y hacer arreglos a su cocina con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 33 years old. She lives in her own house with her three children aged 16, 10 and 2 years old. The oldest is in Secondary school and the second oldest attends the National school of the district of Pucara. She lives in the rural part of the district which is in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.

Tomasa's business is selling salchipollos and salchipapas (local fast-food that consists of sausages or chicken and fries mixed together). Her stand is located in front of the Pucará police station. She has worked in this field for more than two years with very good references. She also works raising and selling poultry like chickens which provides additional income with allow her to pay off the loan with no great problem.

The loan will be invested in her business stocking it with new products like soft drinks amongst others and make improvements to her kitchen. Doing this she will generate greater income and be able to improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in her business stocking it with new products and make improvements to the infrastructure.

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS POSITIVAS” es un grupo conformado por socios trabajadores y responsables dedicados al comercio minorista. Elena tiene 55 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda hace varios años el cual su único ingreso económico con el cual ha podido educar a sus hijos cuando estos eran pequeños. Ella a la vez 	es consultora de belleza. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes gaseosas leche conservas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elena es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The Las Positivas group is a group that is comprised of hard-working and responsible members who are devoted to small trade.

Elena, age 55, is single with independent children.  She set up her store at her house several years ago.  It is her only source of income.  With the store she was been able to educate her children when they were little.  At the same time, she is a beauty consultant.

She will use the loan to buy more groceries, soft drinks, milk, and canned food.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was provided.

Elena is the second one on the left.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, soft drinks, milk, and canned food.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, está casado y tiene siete hijos con edades de 34, 32, 30, 27, 24, 22 y 17 años, toda la familia vive junta pero solo tres de sus hijos aún son dependientes, él se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando específicamente maíz y frijol, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 20 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, su padre le enseño a sembrar.
El préstamo le será de ayuda para comprar abono, plaguicidas y semilla para sembrar granos básicos, espera que la inversión sea de utilidad para su vida cotidiana y familiar, ya que de la siembra de maíz y frijol puede alimentar a su familia y tener recursos económicos para cubrir otras necesidades.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and has seven children aged 34, 32, 30, 27, 24, 22 and 17 years old. The whole family lives together but only 3 of his children are still dependent.

He works in the fields specifically growing corn and beans, an activity he has been doing for 20 years. He works from Monday to Saturday. His father taught him how to grow.

The loan will help to buy manure, pesticide and seeds to grow basic grains. He hopes that the investment will be useful for his daily and family life as the growing of corn and beans can feed his family and have economic resources to pay for their other needs. His dream is to continue working and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, pest control and seeds to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Javier Hilarion

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años y una hija de 5 años, y su negocio es el servicio de transporte urbano e interdepartamental.
Él es buen padre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘pampahasi’ ubicado al norte de la ciudad, al pie de las faldas del cerro que fue el primer ingreso español al lugar. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Javier es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y con sus hijos; el mayor está iniciando la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de cemento y ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de transporte interprovincial; diariamente él viaja a las provincias del norte, transportando pasajeros y carga, “el camino de tierra destroza la movilidad y constantemente debemos realizar mantenimiento…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos y diarios, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar el mantenimiento y cambio de llantas. Su sueño es comprarse otro vehículo, él desea pagar el mantenimiento del vehículo y comprar llantas para continuar trabajando. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que trabaja como transportista.
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para pagar el mantenimiento del vehículo y comprar llantas para continuar trabajando y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is a 34-year-old man. He lives with his partner and has a 2-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. His business is providing urban and interdepartmental transportation services.

He is a good father, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, responsible, and very hard working. He does his work in the Pampahasi area, located in the northern part of the city at the foot of the hillside, which was the first Spanish entry into the area. The area is a cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius. 

Javier has brown skin, dark eyes, short black hair, a short stature, and a strong physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in everyday life and for his work. He shares his life with his partner, who sells secondhand clothing, and with his children. His older child is beginning school, and the younger one is still not of school-age. They live in their own room built of cement and brick, with a corrugated iron roof and wooden floor. Their home has drinking water, electricity, and indoor plumbing. 

His business is providing inter-province transportation services. Daily, he travels to the northern provinces, transportation passengers and cargo. He says that the earthen road damages the vehicle, and that they constantly have to do maintenance work on it. The advantage of his business is that he has continuous and daily clients. The disadvantage is that he lacks the money to pay for the vehicle maintenance and tire change. 

His dream is to buy himself another vehicle. He wants to pay for the maintenance for his vehicle and to buy tires so that he can continue working. This is his second sequence of loans with the institution in the 10 years that he has worked as a driver.

It is for these reasons that Javier requests a loan to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires so that he can continue working and feed his family.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires so that he can continue working and feed his family.

loans.name: Nhóm 09- Thôn 9 - Đông Minh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tịnh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Tịnh is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 09- thôn 9 - Đông Minh solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Tịnh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Tịnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tịnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old from Manukan. She works hard to support and feed her four children who are now at school age. 

For eight years, she has done retailing business in their locality. Marilyn would like to take advantage of her good fortune. 

Marilyn availed another loan to restock her store with basic commodities and beverages. She wants to have enough inventories not to miss sales. 

In the future, Marilyn hopes to see all her children finish their own studies and have stable careers.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and beverages

loans.name: Merican Group

texts.en:
This is 45 years old Nmah, she is married and has five children.  Her children are all school going children.  Nmah belongs to a solidarity group of 4 women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams.  “Merican” is the name of Nmah’s solidarity group.  Merican group needs a total loan of 4,000,000SLL. Nmah will receive 1, 000,000SLL which she needs in order to purchase more bags of raw foo-foo for her business.

Nmah established her raw foo-foo business in 2006; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs.  Nmah uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education.  She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week.  Nmah is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 7 am to 6 pm. 
 
In the future, Nmah plans to support her children to acquire university education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman.  She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of raw foo-foo for her business.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Productivas Group

texts.es:
Solidaria Mujer Productivas es un grupo que está constituido por mujeres de la comunidad de la Carpio, en este caso son vecinas y conocidas de la zona, las cuales deciden unirse para conformar este grupo, recibieron la capacitación de Banco Mujer completa, aun así se les recomienda reforzar un poco más en la sesión tres de Gestión Financiera. 
Una de las integrantes son doña Alba, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 8 hijos, se vino a vivir a Costa Rica desde hace 24 años, inicio trabajando en casas realizando labores domésticas, luego tuvo una venta de comida Nicaragüense al lado de su casa allí estuvo durante diez años, pero por problemas de salud debió cerrarlo, actualmente es comerciante, lo cual ha logrado mejorar y adquirir experiencia gracias al tiempo que lleva en este negocio, el cual le permite aportar a los gastos del hogar y poder enviarle dinero a su hermana y mamá la cual es adulta mayor y ahorita esta muy enferma, las cuales están en Nicaragua. Necesita este crédito para invertir en compra de mercadería que le solicita su clientela. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y buen servicio que se ofrece.
texts.en:
The Solidaria Mujer Productivas is a group that is comprised of women from the Carpio community.  In this case they are neighbors and acquaintances from the area.  They decided to form this group, and they received thorough training from Banco Mujer.  Even so, it is recommended that they put forth a little more effort in the third session on financial management.

Alba, age 49, is one of the members.  She has eight children.  She came to live in Costa Rica 24 years ago.  She started working in houses doing domestic work.  Then she had a business next to her house selling Nicaraguan food.  She had the business there for ten years.  However, due to health problems, she had to close it.  She is currently a merchant.  As such, she has managed to improve and to gain experience, thanks to the amount of time she has been in this business.  It allows her to pay for the household expenses, and she is able to send money to her sister and her elderly mother, who is now very sick.  They are in Nicaragua.

She needs this loan to buy merchandise that her customers request.  She chose Fundación Mujer because of the low interest rate and the good service they provide.

loans.use: to buy products for personal use.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucita works hard to support her family.

Lucita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

Lucita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Belen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Belen is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sna's Group

texts.en:
Sna is a 46-year-old farmer living in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province and she is a widow. For a living, she is growing rice on one-hectare area of farmland as the main source of income. Additionally, she is raising five chickens in order to supplement the family’s income. She has been involved in these jobs for 26 years and she can earn about 25,000KHR per day. 

This is Sna’s second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she fully repaid her past loan. This time, Sna is leading a group of two to get a new loan to buy fuel and fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn get good yields and be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fuel and fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in basic grains, vegetables, oil, condiments, propane gas, firewood, etc. to increase her inventory and prepare new varieties of food.

loans.name: Jose Edenilson

texts.es:
José, atiende un taller mecánico automotriz, vive con su esposa y un hijo, ellos dependen del trabajo que el sr. José realiza y no tiene parientes en el extranjero, el negocio lo tiene hace 6 años, heredo los conocimientos de su familia, tiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana cuatro de la tarde.
Con la finalidad de darles a sus clientes un buen servicio, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar un juego de llaves, cables, aceite, luces, etc., tendrá a su disponibilidad un equipo de trabajo que le permita realizar sus actividades sin dificultades, espera tener resultados positivos con la inversión y cancelar su deuda con buena calificación crediticia.
Sus sueños son crecer con su negocio, que sus clientes continúen confiando en su trabajo y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José runs an automotive mechanic's workshop. He lives with his wife and a son. They depend on the work that Señor José does, and they don't have relatives abroad. He has had the business for 6 years. He inherited the knowledge of his family. He has a work schedule from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon.

With the goal of giving his customers good service, he has made the decision to apply for a loan to be able to buy a set of keys, cables, oil, lights, etc., so that he will have available a set of working supplies that will allow him to carry out his business activities without difficulties. He hopes to have positive results from the investment and pay off his debt with good loan qualifications.

His dreams are to grow with his business, have his customers continue to be confident of his work, and to change the style of his family life.

loans.use: to buy a set of keys, cables, oil, lights, etc, so that he will have working equipment at his disposal that will allow him to carry out his business without difficulties.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. Lydia busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with giving her the capital to support her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Lydia wishes to become the supplier of flowers in any shops and boutiques in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy is married, he lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Philippines. He is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than 25 years. 

He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, he hopes to own another rice field to till.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel. Rosa operates a fishing business with her husband. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of the family especially her children's education until they graduate and get their own jobs. 

Rosa requested a loan of 14,900 PHP, which she will use to repair their fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, she hopes to build her house of concrete.

loans.use: to repair their fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is a a hardworking mother who is always out in the streets to sell her fish. She is very diligent and determined fish vendor and she works hard so she can sustain her needs. She is from Oroquieta. 

Bobby has applied for her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. Bobby is in need of capital to purchase more kilos of fish to resell. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 15,000 and she is thankful to them for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to manage it well for her loyal customers. 

Bobby deeply wishes that someday, she could own a stall in the market where she can display her fish.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fish to resell.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre que ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo, el decidió ocupar el espacio de su casa para hacer habitaciones  y luego rentarlas a personas de su pueblo que lo necesitan.  Le ha ido muy bien, el antes ya había solicitado un préstamo a Kiva junto MiCrédito para construir un baño que cumpliese con todos los requerimientos higienicos, para dejar de usar una letrina y no seguir contaminando el suelo y perjudicando su salud.
Ahora, este hombre trabajador vuelve a pedir un financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de otro servicio higiénico y así mejorar la calidad del servicio que presta. En un futuro Carlos desea poner un hotel, está seguro que aún le falta crecer como un empresario emprendedor.
texts.en:
Carlos is a man who has succeeded in going forward with a lot of effort. He decided to use the space in his house to make rooms and then to rent them to people in the town who need them. It has been going very well for him. 

Previously, he had solicited a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to build a hygienic bathroom, so that he and his guests could stop using a latrine and stop contaminating the floor and harming their health.

Now, this hard-working man returns to ask for a loan to construction materials and pay workers to build another hygienic bathroom and, thus, to improve the quality of the service he offers. 

In the future, Carlos wants to establish a hotel. He is sure that he can still grow as an enterprising businessman.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay works to build another hygienic bathroom.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma is 49 years old and has eight children. Ma. Emma is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Emma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Emma has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Samey's Group

texts.en:
Samey, a 44-year-old farmer, lives in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married woman blessed with four children, three of whom are depending on her. There is one child who is still in school. 

To support them to live, she grows cassava on six-hectare farmland which is the main source of income. In order to supplement her income, she sells grocery items. She has been involved in this business for 26 years. 

This is Samey’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the representative of group, Samey will spend her loan portion to buy pesticides, seeds and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can get good outputs from her business and she also wants to grow pepper to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pachocol Group

texts.es:
Lucia (la primera del lado derecho de blusa color morado) es una mujer de 27 años de edad, es soltera tiene un hijo de un año, vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Lucia con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su hijo se dedica a la venta de café, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace siete años.
Lucia ahora necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra para el mantenimiento de café, pues es fundamental que el cultivo reciba su mantenimiento  para obtener buena cosecha.
Lucia tiene el anhelo de incrementar su cultivo para el próximo año y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia (the first one on the right with a purple shirt), age 27, is single and has a one year old son.  She lives in the Nahuala community.  Out of the desire to get income and to get her son ahead, Lucia sells coffee.  She has been doing this work for seven years.

Lucia now needs a loan in order to be able to buy fertilizers and to pay for the labor for maintenance of the coffee.  It is fundamental that the crop receive maintenance in order to get a good harvest.

Lucia wishes to increase her crops next year and to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for the labor for maintenance of the coffee.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach, 46, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children. For the last seven years, Mach has been buying and selling bamboo and growing chili pepper. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day. 

Mach has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she completely repaid the loan. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers to grow chili pepper and bamboo for resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow chili pepper.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and has 7 kids. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family. In 2010, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pay her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently she has asked for a loan of PHP 20,000 for additional capital for fishing, which is to purchase new nets and and other fishing accessories.  She makes use of teared foam in their fish vending and hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she believes she will raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business. 

Claudia  has found comfort for their financial needs from Paglaum MPC, for which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and and other fishing accessories.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Carlos Andrés

texts.es: Carlos de 28 años es un apasionado de la informática y no dudo ni instante estudiar una rama de esta profesión, se convirtió en técnico en reparación y mantenimiento de computadores e inició su negocio en el año 2013, el éxito no se hizo esperar, hoy en día cuenta con una amplia clientela que goza de sus servicios con toda la confianza.  Él siempre está dispuesto a ofrecer servicios de calidad y con las garantías requeridas para generar una buena imagen y ser recomendado ante otros clientes. Carlos es muy comprometido con su trabajo por eso está disponible todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. en la actualidad desea realizar una inversión con la que comprará piezas y repuestos para armar equipos y colocarlos en venta, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Su meta a futuro es continuar estudiando una carrera profesional y así poder abrir su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28 years old, is passionate about computers and didn't hesitate for a moment to study this as a profession. He became a technician of repairing and maintaining computers and started his business in 2013. His success was immediate, and today he has a wide clientele that enjoy his services with confidence. He is always available to offer quality services with guarantees required to generate a good image and be recommended to other customers.

Carlos is very committed to his work and is available every day from 9 am to 8 pm. Currently, he hopes to make an investment with which he will buy spare parts for assembling equipment to be sold. For this, he is applying for his first Kiva credit through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. His goal for the future is to continue studying a professional career and be able to open his own store.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for assembling equipment to be sold.

loans.name: Kemsoern's Group

texts.en:
Aged 49 years, Kemsoern is a widowed mother of nine children and she lives with her family in a rural area located in the Memot district of Kampong Cham province. Two of her children are still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava which she had been in for 29 years. She can earn about KHR 60,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about 30,000 each day for the future. 

This is the sixth loan for Kemsoern with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing her rice and cassava. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing her rice and cassava.

loans.name: Liderazgo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El grupo “LIDERAZGO DE MUJERES” es un grupo conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Roxana tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de panes yogurt galletas kekes lo cual ofrece a sus conocidos y familiares. Y a la vez presta servicios de empleada domestica los fines de semana con la finalidad a apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación y alimentación de sus dos hijos. el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas panes yogurt galletas y kekes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Roxana es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho tiene a su bebe en brazos.
texts.en:
The "Liderazgo de Mujeres" [Women's Leadership] group is formed by responsible and hard-working women. Roxana is 26 years old and lives with her 2 children, who are in school. She makes a living by selling breads, yogurt, cookies and cakes which she offers to her friends and family members. At the same time, she offers domestic help services during the weekends in order to support her husband with the costs of education and food for their two children. She will invest the loan to purchase more breads, yogurt, cookies and cakes. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for their support. Roxana is the second person standing at the right side of the photo with her baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy more bread, yogurt, cookies and cakes.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, está programado sus actividades agrícolas para la nueva temporada de siembra y necesita ayuda con un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas que son básicos para que el cultivo de granos básicos tenga un buen desarrollo, espera obtener una cosecha abundante.
Su negocio está mejorando la rentabilidad con la ayuda de créditos, el estilo de vida es más confortable y ha disminuido sus deudas.
texts.en: Jose is scheduling his agricultural activities for the new planting season and needs help with a new loan to invest in agricultural inputs that are essential for the cultivation of basic grains to develop well. He hopes to have an abundant harvest. With the help of loans, his business is improving its profits, his standard of living is more comfortable and he has decreased his debts.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural inputs that are essential for the cultivation of basic grains to develop well.

loans.name: Abazbek

texts.ru: Абазбек, 36 лет, женат. У него - среднее образование. С 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая картофель на 0,40 ГА арендованной земли. Также есть 3 коровы и 10 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Абазбека, его ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Абазбек является участником группы "Астра", всего в группе - 3 человека. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Abazbek is 36 years old. He is married. He has a secondary education. He has been rearing animals and growing crops since 1995, growing potatoes on 0.4 hectares of rented land. He also has three cows and ten sheep. Thanks to Abazbek's hard work, his monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). In order to develop his business further, he has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy some calves. Abazbek is a member of the Astra group in which there are three people. He plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing his number of domestic livestock in order to have the opportunity to improve the material well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy some calves to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 38 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Айгул - среднее образование. С 1993 года занимается животноводством, есть 7 коров, лошадь. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, ее ежемесячный доход составляет 8,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 нетели. Айгул является участником группы "Астра", всего в группе - 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Aigul is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Aigul has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals since 1993 and has seven cows and a horse. Thanks to Aigul's hard work, her monthly income is 8,800 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a heifer. Aigul is a member of the Astra group which comprises three people. Aigul plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock in order to save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Mailykan

texts.ru: Майлыкан, 41 год, замужем, есть 4 дочерей. У Майлыкан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода, она занимается сельским хозяйством. На 0,20 Га собственной земельной доли Майлыкан с супругом выращивают экологически-чистые и вкусные картофель и помидоры. Ежемесячная прибыль Майлыкан составляет до 11,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Майлыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и образование ее детей.
texts.en: Mailykan is 41 years old, married, and has four daughters. Mailykan has a secondary education. She farms for her main income. Mailykan and her husband grow tasty organic potatoes and tomatoes on a 0.2 hectare plot of their own land. Mailykan's monthly profit is up to 11,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and seeds and to prepare her plot of land. Mailykan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her business and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to cultivate her land and grow organic tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: 030805200001.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy has a retail business selling vegetable. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable and resell.

Thủy is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 030805200001.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  Thủy lives with 2 dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and resell, to provide for the welfare of her family, now and in the future

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 59 years old and married with eight children, two of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Josephine has borrowed and paid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marry Lou

texts.en:
Marry Lou is 65 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marry Lou has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Marry Lou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Josita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.  Josita is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Josita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ging

texts.en:
Ging is 38 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Ging requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ging has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ging would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, con estos materiales podrá sembrar maíz, con la cosecha que obtenga almacenara una parte para consumo familiar y el resto lo venderá.
Al utilizar créditos como una herramienta importante para mejorar su negocio ha experimentado un cambio positivo, está mejorando la situación económica familiar y optimizando el estilo de vida que comparte con los suyos.
texts.en:
Roberto needs a new loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides. With these materials he will be able to plant corn. He will keep part of the harvest that he gets for family consumption, and he will sell the rest.

By using loans as an important tool to improve his business, he has experienced a positive change. His family’s economic situation is improving and the lifestyle that he shares with his family is getting better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides. With these materials he will be able to plant corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil and bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 43 years old and married with three children who are in school. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: 030805020003.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Hương is applying for a loan to purchase more clothes to resell. She has a retail business selling clothes.

Hương is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 030805020003.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hương has been involved in this business for 6 years.

The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell, so as to provide for her children and increase her business

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Bắc Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Phương is 37 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Bắc Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents.

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell and for use in her restaurant

loans.name: Joylne

texts.en:
Joylne is 30 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school, Joylne works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, eggs, milk, sugar.

Joylne has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Joylne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, eggs, milk, sugar

loans.name: Nhóm 08 - Thôn 9 - Đông Minh Group

texts.en:
Mr Lúa works in agriculture raising poultry. He is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Lúa is 39 years old and he is single with no children. Lúa is the group leader of the Nhóm 08 - thôn 9 - Đông Minh solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. 

In 2014, Lúa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his  business.  He has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and has been involved in this business for 5 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns him is the lack of capital.

With his business profit, Lúa hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future, for the business to grow and be able to build a new house

loans.name: Zulfiqor

texts.en:
Zulfiqor is an amenable man. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan to a family of workers. He lives in rural area with his family. He is married and has children.

He and his wife are working at a secondary school: he works in security and his wife is a cleaning woman. They have normal standard of living. He spends his salary on feeding their family.

His house is in bad condition and needs to be renovated. He does not have enough money to renovate his house. He appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy construction materials and renovate his house. He awaits KIVA lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and renovate his house

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en:
Neciforo makes a good living with every quarter of his farm in Oqoquieta in the Philippines. This is his means of supporting his family. Neciforo has been able to put all of his children through school until they graduated and secured their own jobs.

With the money he had saved up, Neciforo purchased a 2-hectare plot. Now he wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts and bananas of a good variety so that he can increase his farm's yield. However, Neciforo is in need of working capital. He presented his project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 38,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow his land and plant seedlings.

Neciforo has high hopes that his farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow his land and plant seedlings

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Aladina

texts.en:
Aladina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aladina is 42 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Aladina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aladina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Aladina has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Aladina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a buy and sell chickens business in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Carmen has been in this business for 3 years now.

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Seab is 30 years old. She is a widowed mother of two dependent sons.

For a living, she has been growing rice on a hectare area of farmland - this is her main source of income. In order to supplement the family’s income, she sometimes works as a paid worker. In fact, she has been involved in her job for 30 years.

This is the first time Seab is partnering with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is now leading a group of three to get a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn good income to support her family’s living in the future time.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Antonieta is 38 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Antonieta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell
